description:
Introduction
Software Developers at IBM are the backbone of our strategic initiatives to design, code, test, and provide industry-leading solutions that make the world run today - planes and trains take off on time, bank transactions complete in the blink of an eye and the world remains safe because of the work our software developers do. Whether you are working on projects internally or for a client, software development is critical to the success of IBM and our clients worldwide. At IBM, you will use the latest software development tools, techniques and approaches and work with leading minds in the industry to build solutions you can be proud of.

Your Role and Responsibilities
You will be part of a team whose mission is to grow the quantum computing workforce in a variety of constituencies around the world. As an IBM Quantum Developer Community Lead, you will collaborate with a multi-disciplinary,global team of developers, designers, researchers, and engineers to bring quantum computing experience to a wide audience. If you are self-motivated, curious, and love to share your passion for technology with others, we have the right opportunity for you.

Your role is to lead community building initiatives with a focus on growing our open source Qiskit user-base working in close collaboration with IBM Quantum researchers, developers, and our partners. In this role, you must have passion not only for technology but also with connecting people and seeing individuals grow in this community.

The ideal candidate must also possess communication skills appropriate for engagement with developers and scientists but must also be able to articulate complex concepts clearly to a non-technical audience. You must be a dot connector to collaborate across many internal and external audiences as a Developer Community lead for our Qiskit community, comfortable with complex problem solving, and able to work independently to set your day to day priorities.

Key responsibilities include:

Strategize on novel ways of reaching new and existing audiences across developer and academic communities.
Lead the delivery of unique and scalable quantum education programs that are relevant to local communities.
Work with various stakeholders inside and outside of the organization to define and deliver on goals.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Passion for building and empowering local communities
Familiarity with the quantum computing academic and industrial ecosystem in the designated region.
Experience in community building, through formal work or volunteer programs.
Background in quantum information science or a related field.
Collaborating efficiently, as well as make creative decisions autonomously.

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
A PhD or master’s degree providing the relevant background in quantum mechanics and/or quantum information processing such as physics, mathematics, computer sciences is a prerequisite.
Have a strong background in Python development and quantum science.
Education and experience on topics related to equity, diversity, and inclusion.

About Business Unit
IBM Systems helps IT leaders think differently about their infrastructure. IBM servers and storage are no longer inanimate - they can understand, reason, and learn so our clients can innovate while avoiding IT issues. Our systems power the world’s most important industries and our clients are the architects of the future. Join us to help build our leading-edge technology portfolio designed for cognitive business and optimized for cloud computing.
This job requires you to provide your COVID-19 vaccination status with supporting documentation, where legally permissible.

Your Life @ IBM
Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement
IBM offers a wide range of resources for eligible IBMers to thrive both inside and outside of work. In addition to a competitive benefits program consisting of medical and life insurance, retirement plans, and time off, eligible employees may also have access to:

12 weeks of paid parental bonding leave. Family care options are also available to support eligible employees during COVID-19.
World-class training and educational resources on our personalized, AI-driven learning platform. IBM's learning culture supports your restless attitude to grow your skills and build the depth and scale of knowledge needed to achieve your career goals.
Well-being programs to support mental and physical health.
Financial programs that empower you to plan, save, and manage your money (including expert financial counseling, 401(k), IBM stock discount, etc.).
Select educational reimbursement opportunities.
Diverse and inclusive employee resource groups where you can network and connect with IBMers across the globe.
Giving and volunteer programs to benefit charitable organizations and local communities.
Discounts on retail products, services, and experiences.

We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Staff Software Engineer, Machine Learning Data
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ's computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.

Quantum computers generate huge amounts of data—and we can use that data to make those very same computers better. We are seeking an enthusiastic Staff Machine Learning Data Engineer who is passionate about machine learning and data engineering. You will help build high quality, scalable, and resilient distributed systems that power our data pipelines. You'll be responsible for leading the development of the key components of our data and Machine Learning platform, while collaborating with experimental and theoretical physics teams, as well as Machine Learning engineers. Help us use data and Machine Learning to build the world's best quantum computers!
Responsibilities:
Lead, design, architect, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve our data pipelines and warehousing
Ensure the quality of our system through design and code reviews
Assist in the career development of others, providing mentorship on advanced technical issues
Collaborate with an experienced interdisciplinary staff
Approach problems pragmatically
Help us continuously improve how we do things
The ideal candidate will have experience leading or contributing to multiple simultaneous product development efforts, projects, and initiatives. You'll be able to balance technical expertise and savvy with strong business judgment to make great technology choices. You'll strive for simplicity and demonstrate significant creativity and incisive judgment.
You'd be a good fit with:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, or equivalent practical experience–untraditional backgrounds are welcome here
5+ years experience in software development in one or more general-purpose programming languages (like Go, Rust, or C++)
3+ years experience with SQL and NoSQL databases
Experience designing data models and data warehouses
Experience with data processing using traditional and distributed systems (e.g., Airflow, Dataflow, Hadoop).
Experience writing and maintaining ETLs which operate on a variety of structured and unstructured sources.
Experience in distributed data processing and Unix or GNU/Linux systems.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
A love of collaborating in an interdisciplinary environment
You'd be a great fit with:
Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, or Statistics, or related scientific field
3+ years of experience with one or more of the following technologies
Kubernetes
Postgres
MongoDB
Airflow
Solid understanding of deep learning platforms like Keras, Tensor-flow and/or PyTorch
Experience determining capacity requirements for Machine Learning workloads, and working with partner teams to ensure scalability and maintainability
Comfort with managing data and Machine Learning workloads in production
Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a 15 minute metro ride from Washington DC. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. However, IonQ will be expanding into additional geographies both domestically and internationally so don't let this stop you from applying.

At IonQ, we believe in fair treatment, access, opportunity and advancement for all, while at the same time striving to identify and eliminate barriers. We empower employees to thrive by fostering a culture of autonomy, productivity, and respect. We are dedicated to creating an environment in which any individual can feel welcomed, respected, supported and valued.

We are committed to equity and justice. We welcome different voices and viewpoints and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, age, sexual orientation, and military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.

If you are interested in being a part of this team and mission, we encourage you to apply.
IonQ Covid-19 Policy: IonQ requires all employees to provide proof of full vaccination for Covid-19 before starting employment.

position:
LOCKHEED MARTIN CORPORATION
9,021 reviews
Grand Prairie, TX 75051
title: Software Engineer Stf / Embedded / C++ / Test / Grand Prairie, TX
description:
COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. With employee health and safety as our top priority, and as a federal contractor, Lockheed Martin is taking action to address the increased risk and uncertainty COVID-19 variants pose in the workplace and ensuring we meet our commitments to national security.

To uphold safety for all employees, we will continue to request vaccination status for all Lockheed Martin employees including new hires. All current and newly hired employees are required to follow onsite safety measures based upon the COVID-19 Community Level at the specific work location.
Description:Lockheed Martin is a global security and aerospace company that employs approximately 114,000 people worldwide and is principally engaged in the research, design, development, manufacture, integration and sustainment of advanced technology systems, products and services. Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control (MFC) is one of four Lockheed Martin business areas. MFC is a recognized designer, developer and manufacturer of precision engagement aerospace and defense systems for the U.S. and allied militaries. MFC develops, manufactures and supports advanced products for military customers that include the U.S. Army, Navy, Air Force, Marine Corps, NASA and dozens of foreign allies. MFC also offers a wide range of products and services for the global civil nuclear power industry and the military’s green power initiatives.

As a Software Engineer at MFC, you will join one of the largest networks of software professionals, implementing cutting edge technologies on both existing and new development platforms. You will be helping us solve the world’s most difficult challenges supporting such wide-ranging domain areas such as aircraft flight command and control, air traffic control, health care, and homeland defense. Software professionals at MFC have the opportunity to work with a variety of technologies such as machine learning and related artificial intelligence, quantum computing using one of the world’s first quantum computers, business applications such Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), naval systems, radar systems, business intelligence/analytics, working on a Infrastructure Service Provider (ISP) team, developing code to support wireless mobile technologies, spacecraft attitude control, development of “green” technologies, robotics, oceanic exploration, missile combat systems, and virtual reality simulation platforms, information assurance/cyber security among other amazing software frontiers. We are a matrix engineering and technology organization so you will touch multiple programs over your career!

MFC is looking for an experienced Software Engineer to develop tests for embedded software. Selected candidate will verify software requirements and performance. Candidate is expected to be proficient in C/C++. It is desirable that the candidate have experience with embedded development using a real-time operating system. For this first assignment, the candidate will work in a team with both technical and career leaders.

Candidates applying to this position should have a Bachelor’s degree, or greater, in Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science or an equivalent field with significant software development experience.

It is possible that travel will be required to both customer and supplier sites. It is possible that travel will be both within and outside the Continental United States (CONUS). Telecommuting opportunities can vary depending on daily tasking. For more details about the classification of this assignment, please see "Ability to Work Remotely".

Candidates filling this position will need a US citizen and will need a clearance at the level specified in “Clearance Level” or will need the ability to get a clearance if not specified. In addition to meeting security clearance requirements, candidate may need to be approved to work Special Access Program (SAP) prior to start of employment.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science or Electrical Engineering.
Secret clearance from DOD
C++11 or higher
Hardware / Software integration
Linux OS
Software testing skills for embedded real-time software
Desired Skills:
Agile Scrum
Continuous Integration / Continious Deployment (CI/CD) systems and build process automation (GitLab pipelines) - usage
Debugging code using GNU Debugger (GDB)
GitLab - source code management / configuration / versioning
JIRA - issue tracking and Agile project management
JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) – data storage and transportation
Software Test Plan development
Software Test Procedure development
Test Cases
Test Reports
Test Scripts using python
Test tool creation using C++11 and/or python
Timing analysis on a real-time application
XML (eXtensible Markup Language) – language for managing data for electronic display
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
job.Qualifications

Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.

As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.
EXPERIENCE LEVEL:
Experienced Professional

title:
Lab and Facilities Manager, AWS Center for Quantum Computing
Job ID: 2282992 | Amazon Dev Center U.S., Inc.
description:
DESCRIPTION
Job summary
The Amazon Web Services (AWS) Center for Quantum Computing (CQC) in Pasadena, CA, is looking to hire a Lab and Facilities Manager with experience in infrastructure build outs, mission critical operations, managing service requests, safety programs, and asset management. The mission of this role is to aid in AWS’s effort to bring cloud quantum computing services to its worldwide customer base. We are seeking a motivated candidate who can who can manage and develop a team, provide technical direction and expertise in infrastructure and operations, and communicate across multiple stakeholders including scientists, engineers, safety and compliance partners, vendors, and leadership.

On this team you will wear many hats, work smart, and iterate quickly. We’re looking for someone who can define a vision for a technical and business opportunity and then execute on that vision. Successful applicants will have a strong and technically oriented background in the maintenance and management of research equipment, managing safety programs, running lab facilities/construction projects, advancing operational standards, and managing a team of engineers and technicians. Successful applicants will have experience defining problems, leading cross-functional teams, and communicating with a large number of stakeholders, including written and oral communications with senior leadership.


Key job responsibilities
Maintain existing lab and facilities. Manage the planning, build-out, and relocation of any new labs or facilities to meet the schedule and programmatic needs of the business.
Create, publicize, and enforce lab procedures and cleanliness/organization standards, partnering with outside consultants when necessary. Organize and set standards for all lab operations - design workflows for efficiency, compliance, and output. Drive cross-functional collaboration to establish and follow work instructions and test and procedures. Work with risk and safety partners to ensure program is compliant, employees are trained where needed, and records are organized and filed.
Oversee our asset and inventory programs. Manage vendors and establish a schedule for maintenance, inspections, and cleaning. Create internal documentation to ensure employees have access to lab guidelines and policies. Work with the security team to ensure access and authorizations are in place for visitors and vendors.
Respond to and delegate day-to-day requests and issues in a timely and effective manner. Plan and coordinate with technicians and engineers on equipment and facility related maintenance, shutdowns, and emergencies.
Analyze and synthesize data - create reports, dashboards, and presentations to convey information across the organization.
Support ad hoc projects, assignments or other related duties as needed.

About the team
You will be joining the Infrastructure and Production team within the Quantum Computing organization. Our mission is to protect and serve quantum computers for our customers in the lab and on the cloud. Our vision is to set the gold standard for infrastructure, security, and operations in the quantum cloud computing industry.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree with focus in a STEM related field
5+ years of experience in a scientific or engineering environment
5+ years of lab and facilities management experience
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Master's degree or Ph.D. in a STEM related field
Experience working on physics or engineering laboratories, which contain low noise electronics, lasers, EMI/radiation shielded rooms, vacuum systems, cryogenics, etc.
Experience working on semiconductor clean rooms, which contain fan filter systems, plumbing and air handling of hazardous chemicals/gases, vacuum systems, etc.
Experience working on data center facilities, which contain generators, chillers, cooling towers, air handling units, UPS, electrical sub distribution systems, fire detection and suppression systems, cable reticulation systems
Experience with computerized maintenance management systems, enterprise asset management platforms, or similar
Proven track record of aligning stakeholders and delivering results on time
Experience hiring and developing a team
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong analytical skills with demonstrated problem solving ability
Eager to learn and enjoy a fast paced environment


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

title: People Operations Manager
description:
About us
We hold the key to making quantum useful! Q-CTRL is a company with a deep start-up spirit with offices in Sydney, Los Angeles and Berlin. Our goal is to revolutionize the quantum future of technology by delivering transformational, real-life outcomes for the world’s most innovative and impactful industry. Simply put, we make quantum technology useful.

We’re led by our values; to be real, be trusted, be just, and be revered. They guide us in everything we do - how we work together and how we shape the future of the quantum field. We want the best talent in the world to join our team - from operations, product, design and marketing through to quantum research. So whether you’re a quantum expert or simply unsure where you fit into a business like ours, we want to hear from you!

About the team:
The Operations team works across the entirety of the global company to ensure the proper business-rhythm is set for our growing business. Focusing on talent, people, information technology, security, program management, and general operations (to name a few), this operationally-driven team transcends administrivia and bureaucracy to “get stuff done.” We lean on automation, data, and innovation to meet our charge to scale ahead of our growth.

What you’ll be doing:
Reporting to the Head of Global Operations, the People Operations Manager role has a wide-range of responsibilities, acting as the primary global resource within the company on all things people. You will help mature and set the future direction for all People related practices, processes, and tools with the goal to create best-in-class employee experiences. You are operationally focused, have a keen eye for details, and are motivated by data.
What you'll be doing:
Own the creation, implementation, and continual enhancement of people programs and strategies to continually evolve the employee experience (i.e. onboarding process, staff retention steps, employee recognition program, and employee engagement solutions)
As a trusted partner, provide advice and coaching to managers to address complex employee situations, including mitigating risk and managing situations that result in the best possible outcomes for the company, teams, and people
Generate actionable and predictive insights from multiple data sets, including engagement surveys, lifecycle surveys (onboarding to exit), and individual/team effectiveness feedback to improve the employee experience, and retention
Ensure People-related legal compliance and immigration (work rights) across our global team
Advise on market insights and trends associated with global compensation and benefits to ensure competitiveness
Ideally you'll have:
5-10 years of experience in a People Operations role
You have proven influential skills and can advise management on best employment practices
The ability to flex between tactical execution and strategic planning
You have a sound knowledge of Australian employment law and regulations. Experience working with USA and Germany-based employees is a plus as we are a global company
You're adaptable and are comfortable working in a business that is rapidly evolving and implementing best practice along the way
Our core values resonate with you (to be real, trusted, just and revered) and you have a willingness to adapt, collaborate and help others
Why Q-CTRL?

Flexibility: We embrace flexibility and remote work so you worry more about your global impact vs a rigid work schedule
Attractive salary: You’ll get to live the start-up life without start-up wages
Equity: We want people to have a sense of ownership in what they do and offer the potential for equity share and annual bonuses
Resources: We are well funded by the world’s best technology investors, letting us chase our ambitions with minimal constraints
Parental support: We offer paid parental leave to support you and your loved ones!
Diversity: We’re an equal employment opportunity employer. We value diversity, inclusion and providing equal opportunities to all, actively supporting initiatives like the ‘ Global Women in Quantum’ program among others
Unique culture: You’ll be surrounded by some of the world’s leading physicists, engineers, product, marketing and design people (to name a few!) with a strong desire to learn and transfer knowledge
Meaningful values: You’ll work with an incredibly supportive team who work consistently to deliver our core values to be real, be trusted, be just and to be revered
Personal development: We provide you with a personal development and wellness budget
Impactful work: Last but not least! You’ll have the opportunity to work in the world’s leading field of technology and truly make an impact that matters!

Please note: Q-CTRL is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that values the strength diversity brings to the workplace. We are committed to being inclusive in the way we hire. We strongly encourage you to apply even if you do not meet all of the requirements mentioned in the job posting.

To recruitment agencies, we do not accept unsolicited branded profiles and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities
The IBM Quantum Business Development Executive (BDE) is responsible for the identification, pursuit, capture and closure of Strategic Partnerships. The BDE will work with other members of the Business Development Team and with members of the Partner Ecosystem Team and Sales Team on the progression of strategic business deals from “concept to closure” and has an important leadership role. The BDE will set technical directions for industry and research applications for Strategic Partners and work with the Applications team and ITS closely in establishing the scope of activities within the quantum ecosystem. The expectation is that the BDE will drive multimillion dollar strategic partnerships in IBM Quantum.

Specific Tasks for the BDE Role:
Set the right customer target(s) and engage with them to build business relationship (involving IBM execs as necessary).
Create strategic Partner Pursuit and Capture Plans.
Present client value propositions, gain client consensus, and drive opportunities.
Provide subject-matter-expertise related to new IBM Quantum Strategic Partnerships
Lead and / or participate in client-facing meetings and own the responsibilities for meetings.
Develop and deliver client facing presentations at an Executive and C-Suite level.
Provide Strategic Partner candidates a comprehensive quantum ecosystem vision and plan tailored to regional characteristics.
Provide basic quantum computing education to decision makers and arrange deep dives with partnership.
Sync with other relevant teams in IBM Quantum and integrate in BD plan with their strategy and directions.
Closely work with Sales team for term sheets, contract and pricing.
Develop and maintain a qualified long-term sales pipeline, executing agreements consistently against that pipeline.
Work with local geo Sales/BD, customers and partnership team until the deal is signed. Sync with the Partner Ecosystem Team to monitor the progress for the next opportunity.
Build and set the technical narrative for business development.
Successfully drive IBM Quantum agreements to closure.

The successful candidate will have demonstrated experience with C- and SVP-level clients, the ability to present business cases and value propositions for quantum computing that resonate with business oriented and technology leaders, program management experience, a technical background and strong business acumen. They already have quantum information science expertise, and will embrace the further opportunity to deeply understand IBM’s quantum computing technology and will do so quickly. They can lead, manage and motivate a deal team over whom they do not have organizational control. For example, it will be necessary to work with many groups across IBM: Finance, Contracts, Legal, Export, Tax, IBM Client teams as well as the IBM Quantum team members, to move a deal from initiation to execution. BDE candidates should have experience in building client relationships, leading consulting efforts, leading meetings, and delivering presentations. BDE’s are expected to perform a variety of tasks, and a wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected.

At IBM Quantum, we are leading a new era of computing. We are committed to change the way the world works by providing the most advanced quantum computing services and engaging with our clients to help them in their research to develop solutions for problems that were previously considered unsolvable even on today’s most advanced supercomputers. We are looking for strong, enthusiastic, and motivated technical Business developers to join us in this effort.

If you are hired into a Colorado work location, the anticipated compensation range for the position is $138,000 min to $213,000 max is based on a full-time schedule. Your ultimate compensation may vary depending on your job-related skills and experience. For part time roles, the compensation will be adjusted appropriately.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Education background in quantum information
Strong negotiation, relationship building and relationship management skills
Confident and influential interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively present to individuals and groups at all levels.
Executive presence
Ability to work in complex, matrix managed organizational environments

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Research background in quantum computing/quantum information science with a track record on research outcomes – PhD in quantum computing related subjects
Experience in a BD or sales role, including pipeline generation
Experience building business cases for emerging technologies

About Business Unit
With more than 3,000 researchers in 12 labs located across six continents, IBM Research brings together hundreds of researchers who possess unparalleled industry expertise to address some of the world's most challenging problems. Join us as we do pioneering work in areas such as cognitive computing, augmented intelligence, quantum computing, and blockchain, to name a few.
This job requires you to provide your COVID-19 vaccination status with supporting documentation, where legally permissible.

Your Life @ IBM
Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement
IBM offers a wide range of resources for eligible IBMers to thrive both inside and outside of work. In addition to a competitive benefits program consisting of medical and life insurance, retirement plans, and time off, eligible employees may also have access to:

12 weeks of paid parental bonding leave. Family care options are also available to support eligible employees during COVID-19.
World-class training and educational resources on our personalized, AI-driven learning platform. IBM's learning culture supports your restless attitude to grow your skills and build the depth and scale of knowledge needed to achieve your career goals.

Giving and volunteer programs to benefit charitable organizations and local communities.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities
Looking for a postdoctoral researcher to conduct world-class artificial intelligence research for theorem proving in a collaborative team environment

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Formal verification and synthesis
Deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Software engineering skills (Python, best practices, git workflows
Functional programming languages (OCaml, Haskell)
Building complete ML/AI Systems from data to results

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Dependent type theory formalization systems (Coq, Lean)
Automated theorem proving
Reinforcement learning in symbolic/combinatorial domains
Language and foundation models (especially applied to theorem proving)
Published results in top AI conferences

About Business Unit
IBM Research is the organic growth engine of IBM and an innovation engine for our customers and partners. As part of this mission, IBM Research anticipates and examines 'What's Next in Computing' to ultimately create and integrate the technologies the world relies upon to solve big challenges and unlock new opportunities. We create and pioneer new markets for IBM, our partners and customers as exemplified in our ongoing quest to reach practical and large-scale quantum computing. Across IBM Research, we realize the power and potential to accelerate discovery with our partners and clients by combining the power of high performance computing, AI, and Quantum, all integrated through the hybrid cloud.

Introduction
As a Hardware Developer at IBM, you’ll get to work on the systems that are driving the quantum revolution and the AI era. Join an elite team of engineering professionals who enable IBM customers to make better decisions quicker on the most trusted hardware platform in today’s market.

Your Role and Responsibilities
At IBM Research, we invent things that matter to the world. Today, we are pioneering the most promising and disruptive technologies that will transform industries and society, including the future of AI, Blockchain and Quantum Computing. We are driven to discover. With more than 3,000 researchers in 12 labs located across six continents, IBM Research is one of the world’s largest and most influential corporate research labs.

We are seeking a Back-End-Of-Line (BEOL) process integration engineer who can work in a highly multi-disciplinary, multi-cultural environment at our Albany research location. This candidate will be leading and supporting BEOL research and development activities, focusing on process development and yield improvement. This individual will work to develop and mature novel processes and integration schemes to build innovative transistor structures that demonstrate the desired performance and yield benefits for future semiconductor technology nodes. In this role, the candidate will collaborate with other individuals and functional teams, define silicon plans, address issues, develop improvement plans, and document and deliver the desired end results. Occasional responsibilities include designing electrically testable macros for test vehicle creation using industry standard layout software.

The selected candidate is expected to work directly with other process integration engineers, device engineers, unit process engineers, operations teams, tool vendors, enablement organization, technology assurance organization and various other teams that support operations and research activities in our Albany Research facility.

Main Duties for This Role:
Design and conduct experiments by running Si hardware to optimize the integration of the processes
Track progress of hardware to ensure desired outcomes
Analyze data to determine best conditions to optimize the process
Identify issues and recommend solutions to improve performance and yield
Design macros and circuits to evaluate various layouts
Create Intellectual Property (IP) and publish learning
Condense and present analyses and reports
Identify and drive opportunities for operational and quality improvements
Oversee and maintain process controls and operational documentation


Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Research & Development in the Semiconductor Field > 1 year
Silicon hardware execution experience
Demonstrated understanding of device physics of semiconductors
In-depth knowledge of Back-End-Of-Line (BEOL) semiconductor devices
Demonstrated understanding of semiconductor fabrication process
Proven analytical skills to interpret physical and electrical data


Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Basic understanding of Design of Experiment (DOE) methodologies
Basic understanding of Statistical Process Control (SPC)
Hands-on experience running lots in an advanced semiconductor fab environment a plus
Basic understanding and experience using operation-related manufacturing execution systems (MESs) for creating/manipulating process routes and data collection
Understanding of Design tools

Introduction
As a Hardware Developer at IBM, you’ll get to work on the systems that are driving the quantum revolution and the AI era. Join an elite team of engineering professionals who enable IBM customers to make better decisions quicker on the most trusted hardware platform in today’s market.

Your Role and Responsibilities
IBM Research at Albany Nanotech is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Fab Operations Engineering Shift Manager. This Manager will be responsible for directing, planning, and managing the work in the 300mm NYCREATES Albany facilities and will directly supervise IBM engineers and partners working in a complex multi-party R&D operational environment, requiring close collaboration with NYCREATES. The manager will spend approximately half their time in the cleanroom environment supporting operations.

This position is for a day shift alternate work schedule: 12 hours day, 3 days working/4 days off; 4 days working/3days off. Individuals must be willing to work any day shift and cross over with the night shift. The Albany facilities runs24x7, and IBM must provide support for all shifts. Strong communication and team building skills are required for this role.The successful manager will be excited to mentor employees of all levels, meet new challenges and exhibit a high-level of interest in understanding and solving complex technical problems.

Responsibilities include:
Meeting Fab throughput, program deliverables, Fab yields, and overall fab quality and continuous improvement metrics
Involved in staffing decisions, training, and employee development activities to build a proactive, engaging team
On a daily basis, build and/or work with cross functional teams, including IBM and partners, to establish priorities between activities and resources in order to meet Fab and program goals
Lead teams to develop and implement longer term solutions to Fab operations challenges, by recommending changes to protocols and procedures
Collaborate with tool owners, facilities and equipment engineering teams to identify areas to improve tool performance, and actively support improvement plans
Data analysis using web based reports and excel to track/report production efficiency/quality and recommend actions to drive improvements
Create PowerPoint presentations and present updates to upper level management
Maintain a safe work environment

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Bachelor’s degree or higher
Two or more (2+) years of experience as a people manager and supervision of manufacturing operations, including planning and scheduling workflow
Demonstrate leadership and strong consensus building skills
Experience with basic manufacturing and production concepts
Hands-on experience in troubleshooting tool, facility or fab operations issues
Clear and effective communication skills (written and oral)
Must be able to work weekend shift

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Five (5) years of experience in the semiconductor industry
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, business, or other technical area
Technical knowledge and understanding of semiconductor processes and tool sets
Working knowledge of industry and management methodologies focused on continuous improvement in manufacturing, such as SPC, SiView or Six Sigma

Requisition ID: R10075057
Category: Engineering
Location: Linthicum, Maryland, United States of America
Citizenship Required: United States Citizenship
Clearance Type: Polygraph
Telecommute: No- Teleworking not available for this position
Shift: 1st Shift (United States of America)

Positions Available: 4

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

The Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) Advanced Processing Solutions Business pushes the boundaries of innovation, redefines the leading edge of exotic new technologies, and drives advances in the sciences. One of our most challenging new fields is Transformational Computing, which combines the unique properties of superconductivity and quantum mechanics to develop radical new energy-efficient computing systems. Our team is chartered with providing the skills to transform computing beyond Moore’s Law, advancing development of computer architectures, processing/memory subsystems, and large scale high performance computing systems. You’ll work in a R&D environment alongside a broad array of scientists and engineers to make these processing solutions a reality and deliver remarkable new advantages to the warfighter.
The Networked Information Solutions (NIS) Advanced Processing Solutions business is seeking engineers to join our Quantum Devices test team.
This position requires work onsite at our Advanced Technologies Laboratory located in Linthicum, MD.
Responsibilities:
Support test and test development activities for Quantum electronics research and development.
Testing procedures for the characterization and validation of quantum device function.
Support the current and future development of test platforms within function, cost and schedule constraints.
Document and implement test requirements and procedures.
Review test plans for accuracy and completeness.
Compile data and help to define changes required in testing methodology, equipment, testing procedures, manufacturing processes, or new testing requirements.
Basic Qualifications for Principal Systems Test Engineer:
Bachelor's degree in a Physics or Electrical Engineering discipline with 5 years of relevant experience. Or a Master’s degree with 3 years of relevant experience.
Work knowledge in the use of at least one of the following programing languages; MATLAB, Python, C, or C++.
Practiced experience with RF test equipment such as: O-scopes, Network analyzer, spectrum analyzers, etc.…
Strong analytic skills and familiarity in performing data analysis.
Knowledgeable in basic principles of microelectronic device physics.
Ability to communicate effectively to team members both written and verbally.
Eligibility to obtain and hold a TS/SCI security clearance.
Preferred Qualifications of Principal Systems Test Engineer:
Experience working with superconducting electronics and associated test platforms test platforms.
Understanding of the principles of superconductivity.
Familiarity working with cryogens and/or cryogenic test systems.
Prior experience working in a laboratory environment.
Ability to adjust to changing priorities and requirements.
RF device test experience.
Active TS/SCI security clearance.


Salary Range: $96,900 USD - $145,300 USD


Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.

The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order 14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/.
Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

title: Director/Sr Director of Business Development - Government Programs
description:
ColdQuanta is seeking an innovative, collaborative team leader to proactively lead the identification and capture of government funding to support the ongoing research and development efforts at ColdQuanta.
The newly hired Director/Senior Director of Business Development - Government Programs (DBDG) for ColdQuanta’s government programs will be responsible for early shaping and identification of opportunities that 1) allow the dedicated team of researchers to continue to evolve a wide range of quantum-based technologies. and 2) identify applications for inserting our technologies into government needs, objectives, and systems. The DBDG will own the entire capture process from identification through contract award, including spearheading proposal approaches, and will continue to support the execution team by serving as the post-capture voice of the customer. The director will coordinate across multiple functions to identify businesses and “win” business that supports the broader ColdQuanta mission and strategy, while also communicating the voice of the customer and associated mission needs to internal stakeholders, such as the execution teams. The Director will report to the President, Research & Security Solutions.

Requirements
Primary responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Negotiating, committing to, and achieving aggressive goals for new business
Developing a robust understanding of ColdQuanta’s strategy and research strengths, and pursuing funding opportunities that connect the strengths of the researchers and engineers with those funding opportunities which accelerate the company’s strategic growth
Supporting the development of business cases and detailed roadmaps that drive decisions
Recommends investments to position the company for longer term growth
Provides guidance and support in developing, modifying, and maintaining business development roadmaps for long-term growth and success
Provides the customer with an additional conduit of escalation to ensure ongoing customer satisfaction well beyond contract award
Drives and supports decisions that propel the team towards success
Collaborates with internal technical and execution partners to identify and promote emergent opportunities and plans
Collaboratively develops persuasive documents with ColdQuanta’s technical staff and business leaders, including but not limited to, white papers, technical abstracts, and visual presentation aids, to accelerate emergent opportunities and plans
Engages with industry and government leaders to develop externally driven partnerships in key technology verticals
Collaborates with ColdQuanta business leaders, technologists, and external partners to grow program opportunities from the identification phase, through proposals, and program kickoff
Identifies and recommends subcontract and partnership opportunities that will form strong win strategies
Other duties as assigned or required
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities (KSAs)
Significant experience in business development and sales, with a focus on government-funded projects and acquisitions, is required
Knowledge of Federal/State business acquisition cycles and processes through hands-on experience is required
Demonstrated ability to get “wins” and to meet assigned quotas and deliverables is required
Demonstrated ability to handle a large, technical, and diverse portfolio
Highly technical background; physics background desired but not required
Security clearance highly preferred; ability to obtain a security clearance is required
Management and leadership experience is highly preferred
Candidates based in CO, Washington, DC metro or the I-95 Beltway, or are willing to relocate to one of the locations, will be given preferential consideration
Ability to travel up to 30%
Benefits
This position will pay $151,500 - $223,818 per year
Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)
Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
Family Leave
Stock Option Plan
Student Loan Repayment Program

Your Role and Responsibilities
IBM Research is seeking an Equipment Engineer to support the Center for Semiconductor Research in Albany New York. Applicants will be part of a team driving the specification, design and installation of state-of-the-art Semiconductor process and measurement equipment. They will support successful daily operations of the facilities, fab support systems and existing tooling to achieve critical research deliverables and ensure a safe fab environment.

In this role, engineers will work collaboratively with IBM development teams, tooling vendors,and site facilities to meet challenging installation timelines for new tooling and upgrades with a focus on ensuring both technical and safety requirements are met. The team is responsible for end-to-end tooling definition from concept to installation.This role provides the opportunity to join a world class team responsible for defining and delivering2nm and beyond technology and the required infrastructure to support IBM Research and its partners.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Bachelor's degree in Mechanical, Chemical, Electrical Engineering or other related discipline
Strong MS Office Skills - Excel and PowerPoint
Excellent communication skills
Ability to drive cross-functional teams
Must have working knowledge of multiple disciplines of fab process tooling, facility support systems, and fab architecture
Strong documentation and organization skills

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Three to seven (3-7) years of experiences in semiconductor Fab environment with exposure to multiple tooling and support system types
Ability to communicate electronically and verbally to suppliers, vendors, contractors (trades) and partner companies
Experience in Health and Safety practices and procedures in a Fab or Lab environment
Strong skills in electrical, mechanical, chemical, HVAC, building controls and UHP gas designs
MS Project or other planning software experience
Project Management Certification or experiences
Experience in fab design and planning, AutoCAD
Basic understanding of advanced semiconductor materials processing and MES systems

At IBM Research, we invent things that matter to the world. We are driven to discover. With more than 3,000 researchers in 12 labs located across six continents, IBM Research is one of the world’s largest and most influential corporate research labs.

We are looking for a Reliability Engineer for advanced logic technology nodes. The ideal candidate will have a background in physics, material science, or electrical engineering. Knowledge and experience with statistical modeling of reliability issues such as time dependent dielectric breakdown (TDDB), Electromigration (EM), Stress migration (SM), and chip package interaction (CPI) are desired. Some of the job responsibilities include reliability test structure design using industry standard layout software, developing and executing accelerated testing and data analysis techniques for reliability characterization and qualification, developing empirical and physics-based predictive models for reliability assessment and qualification, understanding the degradation/failure mechanisms and reliability requirements for interconnects, contributing to the definition of reliability targets, designing experiments to identify the root cause of reliability failure/malfunction, and driving cross-functional teams to enable reliability improvement.

The position requires interaction with cross-functional and multi-company working teams that include engineers engaged in interconnect process integration, design/layout, and materials and process development. Generation of intellectual property for IBM and protection of it through the patenting process are also expected. The hired candidates must possess strong analytical and design-of-experiment knowledge, excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Hands-on experience with BEOL characterization and reliability evaluation for technology qualifications and new technology development (> 3yrs)
Applied knowledge of data analysis and statistical modeling (>3 yrs)
Knowledge of novel materials and processes for BEOL technology (> 3 yrs)
Knowledge of BEOL integration for semiconductor technology (> 3 yrs)
Well-developed verbal and written communication skills
Strong problem-solving skills including innovation, critical thinking, and analytical abilities.
Ability to summarize results in a clear and concise format.


Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Programing skills in JMP/Python/C++/Java
Hands-on experience with electrical characterization instrumentation and testing algorithm development

Your Role and Responsibilities
IBM Research at Albany Nanotech is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Fab Operations Engineer. This engineer will be responsible for directing, planning, and managing the work in the 300mm NYCREATES Albany facilities and will collaborate with IBM engineers and partners working in a complex multi-party R&D operational environment, requiring close collaboration with NYCREATES. This engineer will spend approximately 75% of their time in the cleanroom environment supporting operations.

This position is for a night shift alternate work schedule: 12 hours day, 3 days working/4 days off; 4 days working/3 days off. Individuals must be willing to work any night shift and cross over with the day shift. The Albany facilities runs 24x7, and IBM must provide support for all shifts.

Strong communication and team building skills are required for this role.The successful engineer will be excited to mentor people of all levels, meet new challenges and exhibit a high-level of interest in understanding and solving complex technical problems.

Responsibilities include:
Meeting Fab throughput, program deliverables, Fab yields, and overall fab quality and continuous improvement metrics
Involved in training activities to build a proactive, engaging team
On a daily basis, build and/or work with cross functional teams, including IBM and partners, to establish priorities between activities and resources in order to meet Fab and program goals
Lead teams to develop and implement longer term solutions to Fab operations challenges, by recommending changes to protocols and procedures
Collaborate with tool owners, facilities and equipment engineering teams to identify areas to improve tool performance, and actively support improvement plans
Data analysis using web based reports and excel to track/report production efficiency/quality and recommend actions to drive improvements
Create PowerPoint presentations and present updates to upper level management
Maintain a safe work environment

Bachelor’s degree or higher
Two (2) years of experience in manufacturing operations, including planning and scheduling workflow
Demonstrate leadership and strong consensus building skills
Experience with basic manufacturing and production concepts
Hands-on experience in troubleshooting tool, facility or fab operations issues
Clear and effective communication skills (written and oral)
Must be able to work weekend shift

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Five (5) years of experience in the semiconductor industry
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, business, or other technical area
Technical knowledge and understanding of semiconductor processes and tool sets
Working knowledge of industry and management methodologies focused on continuous improvement in manufacturing, such as SPC, SiView or Six Sigma

IBM Research is seeking an Industrial Engineer to support the Center for Semiconductor Research in Albany, New York.

This engineer will help ensure the successful operations of the 300mm research line. This role will include capacity planning and projecting tool utilization, along with daily tactical management of fab operational goals. Proven industrial engineering skills and knowledge, with the ability to lead cross functional teams, is required. Experience with SiView and RTD are preferred. Demonstrated Microsoft Excel skills and a passion for data analysis are keys to be successful in this position.

Role responsibilities:
Optimize operations based on product mix, tool capacity, and research requirements
Maximize equipment output by modeling theoretical capacity, including expected availability, utilization, and tool efficiency, and working with equipment owners to improve throughput, reduce bottlenecks for critical operations and processes
Monitor and manage upcoming short-term production bottlenecks, as well as plan for strategic scenarios
Develop models, databases and spreadsheet to analyze productivity data and establish key productivity targets
Coordinate production starts and controls WIP flow
Size and advise on man to machine (MTM) requirements to meet productivity targets

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Bachelor's degree in Industrial Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Operation Research, Management Science or a related field
At least three (3+) years of experience applying industrial engineering experience concepts in a manufacturing or research environment
Proven MS Office Skills-Excel and Powerpoint
Strong analytical and communication skills
Basic knowledge of logistic processes and systems in manufacturing
Basic knowledge of capacity, productivity, and manufacturing process


Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Five or more (5+) years of working experience in the semiconductor industry
Experience in Real Time Dispatching (RTD)
Experience in Manufacturing Engineering
Python, Java or SQL experience

At IBM Research, we invent things that matter to the world. Today, we are pioneering the most promising and disruptive technologies that will transform industries and society, including the future of AI, Blockchain and Quantum Computing. We are driven to discover. With more than 3,000 researchers in 12 labs located across six continents, IBM Research is one of the world’s largest and most influential corporate research labs.

We are seeking engineers in the area of advanced lithography for semiconductors and related devices, including Optical and Extreme Ultraviolet lithography. The hired candidates will have expertise in process development of critical lithography levels in cutting edge semi-conductor processing. Some of the job responsibilities include dimensional/property characterization, and overlay analysis and control for analysis of patterning performance. The candidates must understand the fundamental principles of lithography, scanner setup, photolithographic materials, and optical proximity correction to define the path for leading patterning methodologies from concept through implementation. The positions require interaction with cross-functional and multi-company working teams that include engineers engaged in unit process development, process integration, design/layout, materials and process development, and computational technology. Generation of Intellectual Property for IBM and protection of it through the patenting process are also expected. The hired candidates must possess strong analytical and design-of-experiment knowledge, excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

You must be willing to work in Albany, NY, with occasional day travel to Yorktown Heights, NY, and infrequent overnight travel to various locations worldwide. (<10%)

This position requires B.S. degree in Chemical or Electrical Engineering, Materials Science or Engineering, Chemistry, Physics or a related field, with relevant industrial experience preferred.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Bachelor’s degree in a science or engineering discipline
Lithography (3 yr)
Semiconductor processing (3 yr)
Design of experiments (3 yr)

IBM Research at Albany Nanotech is currently seeking an engineer in the area of semiconductor metrology.

The hired candidate will have experience in materials science, physics, metrology, and/or computational lithography. The candidate must understand the fundamental principles of semiconductor processing, dimensional/property characterization, and lithography. The candidate will define the path for leading methodologies from concept through implementation. The hired candidate must also possess strong analytical and design-of-experiment knowledge, excellent written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to articulate difficult concepts to an audience with diverse technical backgrounds.

Some of the job responsibilities include the characterization of advanced structures through electron microscopy, and analysis of measurement performance, stability, and sources of anomalies. The position requires interaction with cross-functional and multi-company working teams that include engineers engaged in process integration, metrology, masks, design/layout, materials and process development, and computational lithography. The position may entail equipment ownership, engagement with vendor companies, and operations support.

The ideal candidate will have experience with patterning techniques, characterization, and/or computational lithography in the context of optical proximity correction (OPC) model development, data collection, and verification. The ideal candidate will have experience engaging interdisciplinary teams to anticipate and develop high quality measurements in these domains. The ideal candidate will also have experience generating technical documentation to share learning, improve training procedures, and propagate best practices. A track record of innovation in business processes, publication in industry of research and development work, and/or basic programming experience are additional valuable qualities, but not required.

Generation of Intellectual Property for IBM and protection of it through the patenting process are also expected.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
General engineering (basic)
Design of experiments and Statistical Process Control (1 year)
Technical communication (in English) (2 years)
Bachelor’s in science or engineering discipline


Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Metrology process development (2 year)
Knowledge of SEM metrology techniques (1 year)
Knowledge of OPC modeling process and requirements (1 year)
Sustaining and improving semiconductor processes (2 year)

Introduction
As a Hardware Developer at IBM, you’ll get to work on the systems that are driving the quantum revolution and the AI era. Join an elite team of engineering professionals who enable IBM customers to make better decisions quicker on the most trusted hardware platform in today’s market.

Your Role and Responsibilities
At IBM Research, we invent things that matter to the world. Today, we are pioneering the most promising and disruptive technologies that will transform industries and society, including the future of AI, Blockchain and Quantum Computing. We are driven to discover. With more than 3,000 researchers in 12 labs located across six continents, IBM Research is one of the world’s largest and most influential corporate research labs.

We are seeking qualified and motivated candidates for a position in IBM research as an OPC (Optical Proximity Correction) Engineer within the semiconductor technology enablement organization. We seek candidates to be part of a dynamic and skilled IBM Research team developing computational lithography solutions for the world's most advanced semiconductor technologies. This role will have broad coverage across the computational lithography landscape from optical to EUV and candidates should possess the skills to develop solutions across many technology nodes. Responsibilities for this role include:


Collaborating with Patterning, Integration, Device and other organizations in DTCO (Design Technology Co-Optimization) forum to help develop RET (resolution enhancement technique) solutions for technology development
Develop testmask solutions for early RET / Model / KW (keyword) development
Develop OPC model and KW solutions for different layer/technology types across multiple OPC vendors
Frequently engage with vendors and understand industry trends to stay at the leading edge of computational lithography development
Interact with infrastructure teams to help improve runtime and optimize OPC solutions for high quality and fast turn around
Develop automated solutions across RET/Model/KW/Testsite to drive quality improvements and more efficient solutions
Strong communication skills are necessary for this dynamic team environment.

If you are hired into a Colorado or Ithaca, NY work location, the compensation range for this position is between $92,000 and $206,900 based on a full-time schedule. The salary will vary depending on your job-related skills and experience. For part time roles, your compensation will be adjusted to reflect your hours.



Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Computer Engineering or related field
Experience with Semiconductor design, electronic design automations systems or similar environments
Knowledge of Lithography systems, optics or similar physics
Experience working in linux environments
Experience with task automation and scripting (makefile, Python, Bash, tcl)

3+ years of experience working in Computational lithography, OPC or similar role with experience in modeling and/or KW generation
Experience with developing RET solutions

We are seeking engineers in the area of advanced patterning for semiconductors and related devices, including multiple patterning and EUV. The hired candidates will have significant expertise in the area of reactive ion etch or a similar field. Introduction
As a Hardware Developer at IBM, you’ll get to work on the systems that are driving the quantum revolution and the AI era. Join an elite team of engineering professionals who enable IBM customers to make better decisions quicker on the most trusted hardware platform in today’s market.

Your Role and Responsibilities
The position is for a Semiconductor Process Engineer with a focus on processes related to semiconductor packaging. The processing engineer will specifically work on bump bonding technology, but a variety of packaging processes will also be important, such as dry film lithography, direct-write lithography, inspection, metrology, wet cleans, physical vapor deposition (PVD), reactive ion etching (RIE), wafer dicing and silicon integration processing in general. The engineer will be a part of a team at the IBM T.J. Watson Research Center, Microelectronics Research Laboratory (MRL), which provides world class 200mm wafer scale fabrication services to multiple clients including Quantum Computing, Artificial Intelligence Center in Albany, as well as multiple Joint Development clients with projects in Health Care and Life science, and the Internet of Things. The engineer will collaborate with these teams' developing hardware for the state of the art technologies.

This position is located in the Yorktown Heights, NY area.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Familiarity with the silicon chip bump bonding processes, wet and reactive ion etch processing techniques for patterning layers, physical deposition processes and silicon chip cleaning processes are important.
Specifically, bump bonding processing for a variety of solders, including appropriate reflow protocols. The capability of learning new processes and semiconductor packaging tools quickly, as well as analytical and software skills for gathering large amounts of data, analyzing the data and automating the process will be needed.
The engineer will drive process improvements optimizing tool use through inspection and metrology, with a goal of tighter quality distribution, higher efficiency (throughput improvements) and great yield.




Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Graduate degree in physics, chemistry, materials, electrical engineering, or a related engineering program preferred, good organizational, communication and presentation skills.

Introduction
As a Hardware Developer at IBM, you’ll get to work on the systems that are driving the quantum revolution and the AI era. Join an elite team of engineering professionals who enable IBM customers to make better decisions quicker on the most trusted hardware platform in today’s market.

Your Role and Responsibilities
At IBM Research, we invent things that matter to the world. Today, we are pioneering the most promising and disruptive technologies that will transform industries and society, including the future of AI, Blockchain and Quantum Computing. We are driven to discover. With more than 3,000 researchers in 12 labs located across six continents, IBM Research is one of the world’s largest and most influential corporate research labs.

IBM’s Strategic Research groups at Albany Nanotech are currently seeking an engineer in the area of test structure design enablement for the world's most advanced semiconductor technologies. We are seeking qualified and motivated candidates for a position as a design layout engineer, including automated layouts and automated design rule checking.

The hired candidate will have experience with electrical engineering, computer engineering, and/or semiconductor characterization. The candidate must understand the fundamental principles of semiconductor processing, electrical testing of semiconductor devices, and/or semiconductor layout design. The candidate will work closely with process development engineers, test structure designers, and layout technicians to create layout automation that meets the intent of the test structure designers. The hired candidate must also possess strong analytical and design-of-experiment knowledge, excellent written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to articulate difficult concepts to an audience with diverse technical backgrounds.

The job responsibilities include developing test structure layouts using both design automation and manual layout per specified requirements, using industry standard (EDA) tools including the Cadence Virtuoso Design Environment and SKILL code. The position involves developing parametrized cells (p-cells) for use in design automation. Engineers in this position interpret design rules and macro specifications, collaborating with engineers from other functional areas to achieve the desired structure while ensuring that designed layouts pass Design Rule Checks (DRC). Specified layouts will be primarily test structures rather than working circuitry. Close and frequent cooperation with development engineers from interdisciplinary teams will be required for this dynamic team environment. More experienced individuals will participate in coordination of projects, teams, and/or infrastructure development.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or Engineering Science
Experience using the Cadence Virtuoso layout design tool, at least 3 years
Experience with Cadence SKILL programming language or related languages (LISP, Perl, etc), at least 2 years
Strong understanding of physical layout, technology ground rules, and semiconductor processing, at least 2 years
Ability to debug errors and solve problems in a team environment
Fluent English (both verbal and written) and strong communication skills

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Strong experience using the Cadence Virtuoso layout design tool, at least 5 years
Experience with Cadence SKILL programming language for pcell development & design automation, at least 3 years
Experience with advanced sub-micron semiconductor technology nodes
Experienced user of Synopsys ICV DRC checking tool
