title: Senior Physicist
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ's computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.

We are looking for a Senior Physicist with experience in experimental AMO physics. As a member of the engineering organization, you'll be part of a cross-functional team whose mission is to lead IonQ on its journey to build the world's best quantum computers to solve the world's most complex problems.
Responsibilities:
Contribute to the system design, modeling, assembly, and characterization of a trapped ion quantum computer
Measure and analyze data on the performance of a trapped ion quantum computer
Closely collaborate with engineers and physicists to develop techniques to numerically model, understand, and continually improve quantum computer performance
Independently and collaboratively design, build and operate R&D test assemblies to to support the current and next generation of world's best quantum computers
Mentor other engineers and scientists
You'd be a good fit with:
PhD in experimental physics or related field, with deep knowledge of atomic and optical physics
Experience designing and running complex AMO systems and experiments
Demonstrated experimental experience with one or more of the following specialties: atomic physics systems, diffraction limited optical systems, lasers (from UV to IR), quantum information science, quantum sensors, atomic clocks, vacuum systems

You'd be a great fit with:
5+ years experience in applying research to relevant industry problems
Experience working with ion traps, ultra-high vacuum and cryogenic systems
Experience aligning and characterizing diffraction limited optical systems
Experience with Python programming for data capture and data analysis
Engineering or systems engineering experience in transforming a complex physical system into a product
Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a 15 minute metro ride from Washington DC. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. However, IonQ will be expanding into additional geographies both domestically and internationally so don't let this stop you from applying.

At IonQ, we believe in fair treatment, access, opportunity and advancement for all, while at the same time striving to identify and eliminate barriers. We empower employees to thrive by fostering a culture of autonomy, productivity, and respect. We are dedicated to creating an environment in which any individual can feel welcomed, respected, supported and valued.

We are committed to equity and justice. We welcome different voices and viewpoints and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, age, sexual orientation, and military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.

If you are interested in being a part of this team and mission, we encourage you to apply.
IonQ Covid-19 Policy: IonQ requires all employees to provide proof of full vaccination for Covid-19 before starting employment.

title: Research Scientist, Quantum Device Theorist
description:
As quantum computing leaders, Rigetti Computing is building the world’s most powerful computers to solve humanity’s most pressing problems. We believe this technology will fundamentally change the world for the better and will affect nearly every industry over the coming decades. Now a public company, we are expanding our Quantum Engineering initiatives!
 As a Quantum Device Theorist, you will be a key contributor to the performance of our quantum processors. You will work in close collaboration with our experimental teams to model the quantum dynamics of our QPUs. You will drive the improvement of quantum operations fidelity on our R&D platform and the stabilization of performance on our QPUs deployed over the cloud. You will collaborate with specialists in quantum algorithms, control systems, superconducting circuit design and fabrication to contribute to our continuous effort toward quantum advantage and quantum error correction.
 We value diversity and are committed to building a culture of inclusion to attract and engage innovative thinkers. Our technology, meant to serve all of humanity, cannot succeed if those who built it do not mirror the diversity of the communities we serve. Applications from women, minorities, and other under represented groups are strongly encouraged.

description:
ColdQuanta would like to engage both experimental and theoretical physicists with expertise in Atomic Molecular Optical (AMO) physics. We are looking for individuals with strong ability in simulation and modeling of AMO and quantum physics. Applications should be self-motivated, energetic, and have great problem solving and technical skills. Candidates with experience doing simulation of quantum mechanical systems, atomic energy levels, Rydberg atoms, and cold and ultracold atoms are strongly encouraged to apply.

The candidate will contribute to the development of ColdQuanta's quantum computing systems. Simulation and modeling work will impact gate and circuit implementations, noise mitigation techniques, system tuning, and system design. The position will support development of new concepts and approaches for future investigations. The physicist will work closely with a team consisting of fellow physicists, engineers, and technicians.
Role and responsibilities
Work with a team building quantum computers based on neutral atoms
Participate and/or lead simulation and modeling projects for improving the performance and design of neutral atom quantum computers
Create, test, and validate mathematical models of atomic physics behavior; use calculation and modeling to inform quantum computing system design
Collaborate closely with both hardware and software teams to define modeling goals, and to build models that advance our quantum computing efforts
Teach and supervise junior team members
Partial remote work possible, but must be willing to relocate to Boulder, CO area
Requirements
Atomic physics expertise to solve problems related to atoms
Understanding of common AMO experimental hardware and techniques
Programming skills:
all languages considered a plus
Python familiarity required
ability to write well-structured, and well-commented code
Fundamentals in data structures (e.g. hash tables), algorithms (e.g. search)
Linux (e.g. CLI, networking, virtual environments)
communicate software requirements for proper software engineering
Concise and structured verbal and written communication
Technical documentation (e.g. diagrams and writeups)
Minimum 2-3 years of experience post-doc

Agile software development of prototypes
Design a system to achieve desired performance at given time and cost constraints
Gather requirements from system stakeholders
Propagate high-level requirements to sub-systems through modeling
Desired qualifications:
Ph.D. in AMO Physics or closely related experience
This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws and regulations, including the Export Administration Regulations (EAR) and the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). Please note that any offer for employment may be conditioned on authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export control laws and regulations without sponsorship for an export license.

Introduction
As a Hardware Developer at IBM, you’ll get to work on the systems that are driving the quantum revolution and the AI era. Join an elite team of engineering professionals who enable IBM customers to make better decisions quicker on the most trusted hardware platform in today’s market.

Your Role and Responsibilities
IBM Research at Albany Nanotech is currently seeking engineers in the area of process technology for semiconductors and related devices, including CMP, wet etching/cleaning, insulator/dielectric deposition, metal deposition, epitaxial film growth, bonding, or anneal/rapid thermal process. The hired candidate will have significant expertise and understanding of the fundamental principles in one or more of these process areas. Some of the job responsibilities include maintaining and qualifying state of the art semiconductor 300mm process equipment and/or developing processes from an early concept stage into a mature element that enables leading-edge technology.

Job responsibilities include:
Maintaining the health of the equipment by collaborating with equipment vendor(s), fab operations, process, and management teams. To accomplish this, you will be using web based statistical process control charts (wSPC), SiView (software to manage wafer movement and tool processing) to collect the wafer history and related data, and web-based software to analyze the contamination, particle, and elemental data available from the wafers. A good understanding of the measurement and material analytical techniques is preferred.
Assess the process window, formulate design of experiments (DOE’s) and make continuous improvement to stabilize processes. You will be working with semiconductor integration teams in addition to the above-mentioned teams in (a).
Fundamentally understand the process tooling and design experiments to develop new processes for advanced technologies. You will be working with equipment vendors, material vendors, and the IBM internal teams to drive development of new materials/processes, create data packages and implement processes on 300mm tools.
Constant industry research and the ability to be up to date with the latest semiconductor equipment & process advancements is part of this job. The ability and willingness to adapt to changing semiconductor technologies is important in this position. Generation of intellectual property (IP) for IBM and protection of this IP through the patenting process are encouraged. The hired candidates must possess strong analytical and excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

You must be willing to work in Albany, NY, with occasional day travel to Yorktown Heights, NY, and infrequent overnight travel to various locations worldwide. (<10%)

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Bachelor’s degree in a science or engineering discipline
One of more (1+) year(s) of experience in Wafer fabrication process and equipment
Strong communication and presentation skills
Fluent in English

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
MS/PhD. degree in a science or engineering discipline
Design of experiments (DOE)
One or more (1+) year(s) of experience with related experience in thin films, metal deposition, vacuum systems, or semiconductor equipment and processes

title: Experimental Systems Engineer
description: PsiQuantum is on a mission to build the world’s first utility-scale, 1 million-plus qubit quantum computer, powered by breakthroughs in silicon photonics and quantum architecture. We were founded in 2015 by the world’s foremost experts in photonic quantum computing and have assembled a world class team dedicated to bringing the world-changing benefits of quantum computing into reality.

title: Senior Process Engineer (Metrology)
description:
Rigetti Computing is developing cloud-deployed quantum computers to solve humanity’s most pressing and valuable problems. We are a highly diverse and interdisciplinary team of scientists and engineers working at the cutting edge of technology in a mission-driven entrepreneurial environment. We believe that bringing together teams from various cultures, educational backgrounds, and technical disciplines helps them to see things from more points of view and to make great products that change the world for the better.

As Senior Process Engineer in Metrology, you will be in charge of the development and sustaining activities in metrology tools and processes that will be used for building quantum integrated circuits. You will spend your time immersed in the hands-on fabrication of these devices. You will work in a fast-paced environment with a wide range of engineers and scientists in process, integration, design, and quantum engineering. The ideal candidate will have experience in metrology.

Introduction
As a Hardware Developer at IBM, you’ll get to work on the systems that are driving the quantum revolution and the AI era. Join an elite team of engineering professionals who enable IBM customers to make better decisions quicker on the most trusted hardware platform in today’s market.

Your Role and Responsibilities
IBM Research at Albany Nanotech is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Fab Operations Engineering Night Shift Manager. This manager will be responsible for directing, planning, and managing the work in the 300mm NYCREATES Albany facilities and will directly supervise IBM engineers and partners working in a complex multi-party R&D operational environment, requiring close collaboration with NYCREATES.

This manager will spend approximately 75% of their time in the cleanroom environment supporting operations. The position is for a night shift alternate work schedule: 12 hours day, 3 days working/4 days off; 4 days working/3 days off. Individuals must be willing to work any night shift and cross over with the day shift. The Albany facilities runs 24x7, and IBM must provide support for all shifts. Strong communication and team building skills are required for this role. A successful manager will be excited to mentor employees of all levels, meet new challenges, and exhibit a high-level of interest in understanding and solving complex technical problems.

Responsibilities include:
Meeting Fab throughput, program deliverables, Fab yields, and overall fab quality and continuous improvement metrics
Involved in staffing decisions, training, and employee development activities to build a proactive, engaging team
On a daily basis, build and/or work with cross functional teams, including IBM and partners, to establish priorities between activities and resources in order to meet Fab and program goals
Lead teams to develop and implement longer term solutions to Fab operations challenges, by recommending changes to protocols and procedures
Collaborate with tool owners, facilities and equipment engineering teams to identify areas to improve tool performance, and actively support improvement plans
Data analysis using web based reports and excel to track/report production efficiency/quality and recommend actions to drive improvements
Create PowerPoint presentations and present updates to upper level management
Maintain a safe work environment

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Bachelor’s degree or higher
Two or more (2+) years of experience as a people manager and supervision of manufacturing operations, including planning and scheduling workflow
Demonstrate leadership and strong consensus building skills
Experience with basic manufacturing and production concepts
Hands-on experience in troubleshooting tool, facility or fab operations issues
Clear and effective communication skills (written and oral)
Must be able to work weekend shift

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Five (5) years of experience in the semiconductor industry
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, business, or other technical area
Technical knowledge and understanding of semiconductor processes and tool sets
Working knowledge of industry and management methodologies focused on continuous improvement in manufacturing, such as SPC, SiView or Six Sigma

Your Role and Responsibilities
IBM Research is seeking an Industrial Engineer to support the Center for Semiconductor Research in Albany, New York.

In this role, you will help ensure the successful operations of the 300mm research line. This role will include capacity planning and projecting tool utilization, along with daily tactical management of fab operational goals. Proven industrial engineering skills and knowledge, with the ability to lead cross functional teams, is required. Experience with SiView and RTD are preferred. Optimize operations based on product mix, tool capacity, and research requirements
Maximize equipment output by modeling theoretical capacity, including expected availability, utilization, and tool efficiency,and working with equipment owners to improve throughput, reduce bottlenecks for critical operations and processes
Monitor and manage upcoming short-term production bottlenecks as well as plan for strategic scenarios
Develop models, databases and spreadsheet to analyze productivity data and establish key productivity targets•Coordinates production starts and controls WIP flow
Size and advise on man to machine (MTM) requirements to meet productivity targets

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Bachelor's degree in Industrial Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Operation Research, Management Science or related field
At least three (3+) years of experience applying industrial engineering experience concepts in a manufacturing or research environment
Proven MS Office Skills-Excel and PowerPoint
Strong analytical and communication skills
Basic knowledge of logistic processes and systems in manufacturing
Basic knowledge of capacity, productivity, and manufacturing process

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Five or more (5+) years of working experience in the semiconductor industry
Experience in Real Time Dispatching (RTD)
Experience in Manufacturing Engineering
Python, Java or SQL experience
Basic understanding of advanced semiconductor materials processing and MES systems
Si/View and/or Applied Materials APF suite product experience

title: Applied Researcher - Quantum Computing
description:
Microsoft Quantum has assembled a talented and diverse international team to create the world’s first scalable quantum computing system. Our full-stack approach involves exciting innovation from the physics at the quantum plane to providing global quantum services. The Microsoft Quantum program strives to fundamentally change the world of computing to help solve humankind’s currently unsolvable problems. We are on the cusp of an accelerated effort in quantum computing. This position offers an opportunity to have a meaningful influence on a revolutionary technology. The research and development effort includes a diverse staff of theoretical and experimental physicists, hardware designers and software engineers around the world.
Responsibilities
You will help us design, develop, and maintain a modeling software toolset used by our quantum error correction and fault-tolerance team. You will focus on creating flexible modeling / analysis tools and will collaborate with researchers and other stakeholders to incorporate new algorithms and techniques into these tools. You will thrive in this role if you love coding, qubits (logical and physical), creative problem solving, and if you are excited about building a scalable quantum computer. We value passion, inclusion, creativity, agility, accountability, collaboration, and a desire to continuously learn and grow.
Qualifications
Basic qualifications:
Experience with Python, Julia, C/C++, or similar languages.
A degree in Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Electrical or Computer Engineering, or related field with the matching following criteria
Bachelor's with 4+ years of related experience
Master's with 3+ years of related experience
Doctorate with 1+ year(s) related experience
OR equivalent experience

Preferred qualifications:
Background in fault-tolerant quantum computing, quantum error correction, and/or benchmarking of quantum systems.
Experience with collaborative software development.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Detail oriented design, coding, debugging, and problem-solving skills.

#Quantum

MICROSOFT BACKGROUND CHECK:
Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.

Job summary The AWS Center for Quantum Computing is looking to hire a Research Scientist with expertise in computational geometry, design automation, and/or research software engineering. Working alongside physicists and engineers, you will focus on developing software for the automated design, layout, and simulation of superconducting or hybrid quantum devices and their packaging. Your work will enable the robust and scalable development of quantum information processors. Work/Life Balance At the AWS Center for Quantum Computing, we understand that developing quantum computing technology is a marathon, not a sprint. Mental and physical wellness is encouraged within our team and throughout AWS. The work/life integration within Amazon encourages a culture where employees work hard and have ownership over their downtime. We are exploring more structured wellness elements including for example meditation, running group meet-ups, and a culture of sharing wellness tips. Mentorship and Career Growth We are committed to the growth and development of every member of the Center for Quantum Computing. You will receive career-growth-minded management and mentorship from a software and science team and also have the opportunity to participate in Amazon's science mentorship programs. You will work closely with quantum research scientists and have opportunities to learn about quantum computing technology and contribute to the development of scientific software for quantum computing at AWS. Inclusive and Diverse Culture Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. title: Lead IT Engineer
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.
 To build the world's largest and most precise quantum computing platform, we need infrastructure that doesn’t quit. We trap atoms in a vacuum chamber and manipulate them with lasers to perform calculations that we intend to scale beyond the reach of today's supercomputers. Unfortunately, the lasers can’t run our information operations. We’re looking for our first in-house Lead IT Engineer to help manage our external 24x7 helpdesk; define and improve our endpoint management, patching, and lifecycle processes; user provisioning and SAML integrations; and more!
We welcome all experiences at IonQ and if you have any combination of these skills, we encourage you to apply!
Responsibilities:
Build the IT function at IonQ! 
Manage and define processes for our helpdesk to follow.
Help us maintain SOC2 compliance by implementing and documenting processes.
You’d be a good fit with:
Excellent project management and communication skills
5+ years experience in IT engineering (e.g., endpoint management, conference room setup, basic networking and system administration, security, etc)
2+ years experience managing Google Workspace including auditing, security features
Strongly capable in a scripting language (Shell, Python, etc.)
Experience operating and debugging Unix/Linux OS internals (e.g., filesystems, inodes, system calls) and networking (e.g., TCP/IP, routing, network topologies and hardware, SDN)
Comfortable partnering with MSPs and IT vendors
You’d be a great fit with:
2+ years experience with an IdP (e.g., JumpCloud, Okta, etc.) for identity and configuration management 
2+ years experience with Terraform, kubernetes, and/or VMware
Experience configuring Single Sign On with SAML
Experience with distributed and cloud based IT environments (users and SaaS tools)
Familiarity with EDR solutions and responding to escalations around alerts
Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a 15 minute metro ride from Washington DC. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. However, IonQ will be expanding into additional geographies both domestically and internationally so don’t let this stop you from applying.
 
At IonQ, we believe in fair treatment, access, opportunity and advancement for all, while at the same time striving to identify and eliminate barriers. We empower employees to thrive by fostering a culture of autonomy, productivity, and respect. We are dedicated to creating an environment  in which any individual can feel welcomed, respected, supported and valued.
 
We are committed to equity and justice. We welcome different voices and viewpoints and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, age, sexual orientation, and military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.
 
If you are interested in being a part of this team and mission, we encourage you to apply.
IonQ Covid-19 Policy: IonQ requires all employees to provide proof of full vaccination for Covid-19 before starting employment.

title: Software Engineer (QIA)
description:
Qblox is looking for a software engineer to help us build a control stack for an industrial-scale quantum computer. These quantum control stacks generate the analog signals needed for the control and readout of quantum bits. Before a high-level and hardware-agnostic quantum algorithm can be executed on a quantum processor, it needs to be compiled to a quantum assembly language that is hardware dependent. In your role as software engineer, you will extend the framework – Quantify – that allows experimentalists to upload and execute quantum algorithms on our electronics and software stack. You would also help in setting up the CI/CD pipeline. You will work closely with a team of experienced software and hardware engineers.

Qblox is the main control-hardware supplier for the Quantum Internet Alliance (QIA), working with several partners throughout Europe (i.e., QuTech in Delft, ICFO in Barcelona, and the University of Innsbruck). Within the Qblox software team, you would be the main responsible for Quantify development for QIA, and work closely together with our partners.

title:
Quantum Hardware Engineer, Center for Quantum Networking

description:
DESCRIPTION
Job summary
We're looking for a hardware engineer who can help us improve the optical packaging of our quantum devices. This position will give you a chance to:
Work on cutting edge quantum technology projects
Spend time in world class nanofabrication and laboratory facilities
Join a rapidly growing team of scientists and engineers to deliver new quantum technologies to AWS customers



Key job responsibilities
You will work as a member of a team of engineers and research scientists to prepare quantum technologies for real world application. You will spend time developing, implementing, and optimizing new techniques for the production and packaging of these devices such that they can be used in customer facing situations. You can expect to:
Learn to fabricate and design quantum devices
Develop cutting edge solutions for optical, electronic, and cryogenic packaging of these devices
Prepare these devices for reliable and autonomous operation
Work as a member of a team of quantum and nanofabrication experts
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelors in Physics, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Materials Science, Nanofabrication, Computer Science, or other related disciplines
Experience working in cleanroom environments
Experience working with either integrated optics or fiber optics
Experience in numerical simulations of optical physics/devices (e.g. Lumerical, Meep, COMSOL, etc.)
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Masters in Physics, Electrical Engineering, Materials Science, Mechanical Engineering, Nanofabrication, Computer Science, or other related disciplines
Quantum or optical device engineering and fabrication expertise
Experience packaging quantum or micro/nano-scale optical devices for commercial applications
Experience packaging quantum or optical devices for commercial applications

description:
D-Wave is the leader in the development and delivery of quantum computing systems, software, and services and is the world’s first commercial supplier of quantum computers. Our mission is to unlock the power of quantum computing by delivering customer value with practical quantum applications for problems as diverse as logistics, artificial intelligence, materials sciences, drug discovery, cybersecurity, fault detection, and financial modeling.
D-Wave’s systems and quantum cloud services are being used by some of the world’s most advanced organizations, including Volkswagen, DENSO, Lockheed, and Los Alamos National Laboratory. We have also appeared in Time Magazine, MIT Technology Review, Forbes, INC Magazine and Wired.

Director, Financial Reporting role:
If you love being an integral part of a company, delivering informative, accurate and timely financial results, and being part of a strong team to deliver these results - this is the right role for you!
Reporting to the VP, Financial Reporting & Compliance, you will be responsible for activities relating to internal and external financial reporting requirements. The role will oversee the implementation of best practices relating to financial accounting and reporting standards, as well as being a key player in the design and implementation of internal controls over financial reporting. The position will work closely with other members of the Finance team to ensure consistency and compliance with financial controls and will interact with external auditors and other stakeholders as required. You will have strong accounting and financial reporting knowledge, with experience in optimizing business systems to support the Finance team’s internal controls process over financial reporting.
Responsibilities:
Responsible for the preparation and timely filing of quarterly and annual financial reports with the SEC (Form 10-Ks & 10-Qs) including drafting financial statements, footnotes, and MD&A
Contribute to the preparation of quarterly earnings release ensuring all financial information is accurate/consistent with the 10-K / 10-Q
Assist in the preparation of monthly financial statements, management reports, certain accounting entries and account reconciliations
Remain current on new accounting pronouncements and technical accounting issues. Analyze, research, and conclude on new and proposed accounting, reporting and disclosure standards issued by the SEC and FASB and prepare memorandums summarizing the impact on the Company and its corporate accounting policies
Subject matter expert in U.S. GAAP (‘GAAP’), with focus on providing advice and guidance on all technical accounting matters and preparation of documentation and accounting assessment
Develop and monitor the Company’s accounting policies and internal controls to ensure integrity of financial and accounting information and compliance with regulatory requirements; and develop new processes to support business evolution
Manage and develop a revenue recognition model for D-Wave’s subscription sales generated through its Quantum Computing as a Service (‘QCaaS’) cloud platform and for professional services sales generated from the Company’s Launch program
Coordinate the Company’s annual audit and quarterly reviews with external auditor
Provide ad hoc analytical support and assist with special projects, as needed
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business / Accounting; CPA certification
2+ years of public accounting experience followed by at least 4 years of experience with a publicly listed multi-currency technology company, preferably with a SaaS-based business model
Proficient knowledge of US GAAP, including an understanding of recent standards, interpretive guidance, and SEC rules and interpretations
Self-motivated and strong analytical / problem solving skills with the ability to research and propose company positions on complex accounting issues
Ability to meet tight deadlines and manage projects concurrently
Experience with equity award accounting and systems (ie. stock options, RSUs, ESPP)
Experience implementing systems, processes, and controls
Proven supervisory and leadership skills
Ability to effectively manage multiple priorities
Excellent organizational skills, ability to prioritize work streams and strong attention to detail
The ideal candidate is:
Energetic, enthusiastic self-starter, who possesses sound business judgment and is a critical thinker
Experienced with Mid-tier systems experience (NetSuite)
Experienced with financial reporting systems experience such as Workiva, DFIN etc.
Highly collaborative in supporting the operational departments
Flexible as priorities can change quickly and reaction time is essential
Able to embrace rapid change
No 3rd party candidates will be accepted.
It is D-Wave Systems Inc. policy to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state/provincial, local law.

title: Senior High Speed Low Noise Electrical Engineer (Hybrid)
description:
About us:
D-Wave is the leader in the development and delivery of quantum computing systems, software, and services and is the world’s first commercial supplier of quantum computers. Our mission is to unlock the power of quantum computing by delivering customer value with practical quantum applications for problems as diverse as logistics, artificial intelligence, materials sciences, drug discovery, cybersecurity, fault detection, and financial modeling.

D-Wave’s quantum computers and quantum cloud services are being used by some of the world’s most advanced organizations, including Volkswagen, DENSO, Lockheed, and Los Alamos National Laboratory. We have also appeared in Time Magazine, MIT Technology Review, Forbes, INC Magazine and Wired.

As of August 8, 2022, our organization is a publicly traded quantum computing company, trading on the NYSE as ($QBTS).

About the role:
Are you a creative, energetic, and self-motivated professional? Do you have an Electrical Engineering or Engineering Physics background with experience in high-speed low-noise electronics? If so, we invite you to join our Engineering department as a Senior High Speed Low Noise Electrical Engineer.

In this rewarding position, you will be responsible for identifying and solving problems arising in the design, development, performance evaluation and improvement of the communication interface to our advanced superconducting quantum processors. A primary goal of this work is to develop and implement D-Wave’s next generation high bandwidth communications electronics incorporating high speed digital design utilizing Xilinx FPGAs and low noise high speed analog circuit designs.
What you'll do:
Design and implementation of next generation quantum processor control and readout system electronics
Continuous improvement of the current electronics systems
Working closely with the multi-disciplinary teams in Engineering and Processor Development and acting as a key interface between the teams
Clearly documenting and communicating the work and progress to the internal development teams
What you'll bring:
Degree in Electrical Engineering, Engineering Physics, Experimental Physics, or equivalent in relevant education and experience
Multi-year experience in high-speed digital design incorporating field programmable gate arrays
Multi-year experience in low-noise, high frequency analog and mixed signal electronics
Excellent understanding of engineering and physics with strong multi-disciplinary technical skills
Excellent critical thinking, analysis and problem-solving skills
Excellent hands-on ability and trouble shooting skills, including circuit debugging with vector network analyzers, spectrum analyzers and related tools
Strong organizational and decision-making skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment that is focused on priorities and end results
Self-motivated, proactive, flexible and passionate about learning
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Bonus qualifications:
Master’s degree or higher in Electrical Engineering, Engineering Physics, Experimental Physics
Experience in microwave circuit design including filtering, switching, multiplexing, and transmission lines
Experience with microwave frequency design
Experience with superconducting circuits
Experience with cryogenic engineering and systems
Strong software engineering skills related to experimental design, data acquisition, and analysis
Familiarity with Xilinx’s tools and with OrCad schematic and PCB layout tools
Knowledge of relevant E&M modelling tools (SPICE, Ansys HFSS or similar)
Registered as a Professional Engineer in British Columbia
Additional information:
We celebrate diverse perspectives to drive innovation in our pursuit. Our employees range from distinguished domain experts with decades of experience in their respective fields, to bright and motivated graduates eager to make their mark.
Our diverse and innovative team will make you feel appreciated, supported and empower your career growth at D-Wave.

#LI-HYBRID

No 3rd party candidates will be accepted.

description:
Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world’s visionaries and innovators in electronic design, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~14,000 employees create world-class solutions in wireless communications, 5G, automotive, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Our technical solutions – and our methods for creating them – help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.

Our powerful culture has led to us being independently recognized on Fortune 100’s Best Companies List and we are “Great Place to Work” Certified. We’re driven, collaborative, ethical, and curious, and we value all ideas, especially bold ones. And our culture extends far beyond our own walls. Our corporate social responsibility efforts support our communities, nurture the next generation of engineers, and promote environmental sustainability.

At Keysight, Inclusion & Diversity is an integral part of our core values. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers. We believe everyone should be respected in the workplace and in their communities regardless of race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, ethnicity, religion, disability, veteran status, national origin, or any protected class. We continuously challenge ourselves to grow in our understanding of inclusion by engaging in a wide variety of diversity programs, initiatives, employee network groups and mentoring/development. This is Keysight – People and Culture - YouTube
Job Description
This position is targeted for a Software Engineer who will join an R&D team inside Keysight's Quantum Engineering Solutions (QES) organization, which is responsible for producing world-leading solutions for the challenging and exciting market of quantum technologies, including quantum computing, quantum communications and quantum sensing.
As a software engineer, you will work with physicists and engineers around the globe, driving innovation across Keysight’s quantum solutions. You will develop software to automate the bring-up and fine tuning of quantum computing systems and to define and execute quantum programs efficiently.
This position is based out of our R&D office in the Cambridge area.

We are looking for a Staff Optical Engineer. As a Staff Optical Engineer, you'll be part of a cross-functional team whose mission is to lead IonQ on its journey to build the world's best quantum computers to solve the world's most complex problems.
Responsibilities:
Work closely with optical and opto-mechanical engineers to develop ultra high precision beam shaping and steering optics
Define, design, and develop precision high NA and large FOV camera optics
Define, design and develop optical modules that incorporate components such as complex lenses, waveplates, and acousto-optics modulators
Work with opto-mech engineers in the development of fixtures and processes for precision opto-mechanical alignment and assembly
Evaluate suitability of design solutions by performing detailed tolerance and stray light analysis
Work on projects from concept development and bring them to completion at the product delivery stage, including initial debugging and sustaining efforts side by side with the manufacturing team
You'd be a good fit with:
Bachelor's degree in Optical Sciences or Optical Engineering
10-15 years experience
Minimum seven (7) years of industry experience in the design, development and manufacturing of laser based systems.
Minimum 7 years industry experience in the design, and development of high NA, high resolution cameras
Good understanding of beam propagation in single mode and multi mode fiber optics
Demonstrated knowledge and experience in production-centric laser alignment techniques.
Demonstrated knowledge and experience in tolerancing analysis, monte carlo analysis and stray light analysis
Experience working with PMTs, CMOS, or CCD cameras
Sustained record of independent creative design activity and expertise with optical systems and subsystems.
Demonstrated knowledge and creative abilities in the design and specification of optical systems and subsystems from the component level to the system level.
Demonstrated skills using optical modeling software tools such as Zemax
Demonstrated strong understanding of optical engineering fundamentals and principles.
Demonstrated strong understanding of optical design, component specification, development, testing, and design for manufacturability.
You'd be a great fit with:
Expertise in Solid Works
Ability to mentor and train others to accomplish technical goals
Experience with cryogenic systems
Experience with high precision motion devices (e.g. piezos, flexures)

location: BOEING RESEARCH & TECHNOLOGY GRADUATE RESEARCHER – QUANTUM TECHNOLOGIST
title: BOEING RESEARCH & TECHNOLOGY GRADUATE RESEARCHER – QUANTUM TECHNOLOGIST
description:
Job Description
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
At Boeing, we are all innovators on a mission to connect, protect, explore and inspire. From the seabed to outer space, you’ll learn and grow, contributing to work that shapes the world. Find your future with us.
Join our exclusive Graduate Researcher Program (GRP) in Boeing Research & Technology during the summer of 2023 and you can build something better for yourself, for our customers and for the world. Boeing Research & Technology is Boeing's global research and development team creating and implementing innovative technologies that make the impossible possible and enabling the future of aerospace. We are engineers, skilled scientists and thinkers, bold innovators and dreamers. 
You will work with other Boeing engineers in a mentoring and collaborative mode in order to address research and development challenges. You are expected to have the ability to analyze and develop solutions to complex problems, have good team collaboration and good communication skills.
Over the course of the 10-12 week program you will have the opportunity to:
Work directly with a mentor in your field of study while finding solutions to real world problems

title: Senior Engineer, Optical Packaging
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.
 IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.
We are looking for a Senior Optical Packaging Engineer to lead the hybrid integration of micro-optical elements and fiber optics with micro-fabricated ion traps.  As a Senior Optical Packaging Engineer, you will be part of a diverse team of packaging engineers, optical engineers, thermal and mechanical engineers, device fabrication experts and physicists dedicated to this goal. This team is part of a cross-functional organization whose mission is to lead IonQ on its journey to build the world’s best quantum computers to solve the world’s most complex problems.
Responsibilities:
Lead the design, development, and characterization of novel ion-trap optical packaging techniques
Drive design, modeling, and assembly of optics and photonics package modules
Stress testing and failure analysis of packaging and individual components
Scope and set objectives for new technical projects centered on device and optical packaging 
Support the full development lifecycle of novel hybrid optics and photonics systems; including detailed design, creation of statements of work for internal and external activities, procurement of components and materials, characterization and testing, and validation
Conduct risk analysis (FMEA) and develop mitigation plans to ensure on-time release and delivery of project deliverables
Assist with the transition from R&D to production, including development of first articles, process qualification,  and technology demonstrations
You'd be a good fit with :
Bachelors or higher in Engineering or relevant field/discipline
5+ years of hands-on optics and photonics device packaging experience, especially with systems which undergo stress cycling
3+ years experience of hands-on optics device packaging design and process development experience in industry
3+ years optical design and modeling experience 
Experience with micro-optics assembly and packaging including micro-lenses, free space optics, and optical fiber-to-chip alignment and attachment technologies for photonic integrated circuits (PICs)
Expertise in identifying and using packaging techniques, components, and materials (solderers, epoxies and the like)to manage mechanical stress and thermal expansion/contraction
Experience with optoelectronic / semiconductor packaging processes such as die bonding, wire bonding, hermetic sealing, fiber alignment and attachment, passivation, reliability and signal integrity.
UHV device/component handling and knowledge of cryogenic and UHV-compatible materials
Understanding of cleanroom and ESD protocols & procedures
Experience with data aggregation and statistical analysis/reporting
Experience using 3D CAD tools like Autodesk Inventor or Solidworks
Excellent communication skills and ability to work on a team
You'd be a great fit with : 
PhD in Engineering or relevant field/discipline
5+ years leading a high-precision optics and photonics packaging development effort 
Experience with thermal, electrical, optical, and mechanical modeling of hybrid devices in Ansys, COMSOL, or similar
Programming experience in MATLAB, Python, or other engineering relevant language
Process development experience using Design of Experiments and Six Sigma methodologies 
Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a 15 minute metro ride from Washington DC. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. However, IonQ will be expanding into additional geographies both domestically and internationally so don’t let this stop you from applying.

title: Principal Software Engineer, Compiler
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.
 Just like with classical computers, quantum computers need compilers to take high-level quantum programs and transform them to a series of optimal instructions—only in our case, in the end they come out as laser pulses. We’re looking for a Principal Compiler Engineer to build a collaborative team to architect and deliver our next-generation full-stack compiler for our quantum computers.
The ideal candidate will have experience leading or contributing to multiple simultaneous product development efforts, projects, and initiatives. You’ll have excellent interpersonal skills, and be able to balance technical expertise and savvy with strong business judgment to make great technology choices. You’ll strive for simplicity and demonstrate significant creativity and incisive judgment.
Day-to-day tasks for this role may include design and implementation of compiler features and optimizations, developing code generation techniques for novel hardware platforms, and mentoring and directing staff and working with hardware teams on future design considerations. In your first three months, you’ll be defining the architecture for our future compiler platform.
Responsibilities:
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve our quantum compiler stack
Ensure the quality of our compiler architecture through code and design reviews
Deliver world-class quantum circuit optimizations
Help hire compiler team members
Assist in the career development of others, providing mentorship on advanced technical issues
Help the industry define the next intermediate representation standards for quantum computing
Collaborate with experienced interdisciplinary teams
Help us continuously improve how we do things
You’d be a good fit with:
Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience
10+ years experience developing optimizing compilers and scalable compiler architecture
5+ years of experience with C/C++ or equivalent systems language
3+ years experience in management and/or leading teams
Proven experience in compiler middle-ends
A passion for durable intermediate representations
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
A love of collaborating in an interdisciplinary environment
You’d be a great fit with:
PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, or Quantum Computing
Code generation for non-CPU architectures (e.g. GPU, NPU)
Prior research experience in reversible computing, linear algebra, or related mathematics
Deep expertise in LLVM
Experience with Fortran
Experience with XLA, Glow, MLIR
A background in digital signal processing 
Familiarity with quantum information science
Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a 15 minute metro ride from Washington DC. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. However, IonQ will be expanding into additional geographies both domestically and internationally so don’t let this stop you from applying.
 
At IonQ, we believe in fair treatment, access, opportunity and advancement for all, while at the same time striving to identify and eliminate barriers. We empower employees to thrive by fostering a culture of autonomy, productivity, and respect. We are dedicated to creating an environment  in which any individual can feel welcomed, respected, supported and valued.
 
We are committed to equity and justice. We welcome different voices and viewpoints and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, age, sexual orientation, and military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.
 
If you are interested in being a part of this team and mission, we encourage you to apply.
IonQ Covid-19 Policy: IonQ requires all employees to provide proof of full vaccination for Covid-19 before starting employment.

title: Quantum Error Correction Architect
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.
 IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution. 
Scaling quantum computers to world-changing levels will take powerful error correction. In fact, the first fault-tolerant error-corrected qubit was demonstrated on a trapped-ion quantum computer at our cofounder’s lab! We’re looking for a Quantum Error Correction Architect to help take us there.
The ideal candidate will have experience leading or contributing to multiple simultaneous product development efforts, projects, and initiatives. You’ll have excellent interpersonal skills, and be able to balance technical expertise and savvy with strong business judgment to make great technology choices. You’ll strive for simplicity and demonstrate significant creativity and incisive judgment.
In your first three months, you’ll begin developing our long-term roadmap for quantum error correction.
Responsibilities:
Develop quantum error correction codes optimized for our current-generation hardware, while helping to co-design new quantum error correction codes in collaboration with our next-generation hardware.
Develop scalable architectures and strategies to execute practical quantum algorithms with increasing levels of complexity using the quantum error correcting codes
Help inform system-level requirements (error rates, classical computing requirements, etc.) to enable efficient error correction
Perform modeling and trade-studies to inform the optimal architecture for our next-generation error-corrected systems
Work with algorithm developers to devise useful error-detection and mitigation strategies for  important near-term applications.
Communicate ground-breaking results both internally and externally through publications and presentations
You’d be a good fit with:
PhD or equivalent industry experience in quantum error correction or related field
3+ years of post-PhD or industry experience in quantum error correction
5+ years writing high-performance production software in a general purpose language like Python or C++
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
You’d be a great fit with:
10+ years post-PhD or equivalent industry experience in quantum error correction
Prior experience in theoretical quantum computer science and/or theoretical physics
Prior experience working with computer architecture and/or quantum computers
Prior experience working with experimental physicists
Prior experience working with trapped-ion quantum computers

Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a five-minute walk from the Metro. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. However, IonQ will be expanding into additional geographies both domestically and internationally so don’t let this stop you from applying.

title: Senior Engineer, Devices
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.
 We are looking for a Senior Device Engineer and as a Device Engineer, you’ll be part of a cross-functional team whose mission is to lead IonQ on its journey to build the world’s best quantum computers to solve the world’s most complex problems.  In this role, you will be the technical lead in an effort to characterize ion-trap and other micro-fabricated devices and device-package assemblies in order to provide essential feedback to design and fabrication teams.  This includes electrical, thermal, mechanical, and optical characterization. 
Responsibilities:
Lead the design, build, and operation of electronic, mechanical, thermal, and optical testing infrastructure for micro-fabricated devices and device package assemblies
Develop characterization procedures and protocols, and data analysis and organization tools
Perform detailed measurements, analyze and organize data, and present and discuss results with teammates for feedback to design and fabrication
Own and maintain cleanroom metrology and testing tools
Work within a team of micro-fabrication engineers, IC and PIC designers, and quantum computing physicists to improve device and device-assembly characterization, metrology, and packaging
You’d be a good fit with: 
Bachelors or higher in Engineering or Physics
5+ years of experience with hands-on electrical, thermal, mechanical, and/or optical characterization of micro-fabricated devices and device package assemblies
Experience building custom testbeds and developing custom device test procedures  
Experience working in cleanrooms with sensitive devices and equipment
Strong data analysis, visualization, and organizational skills
Strong programming skills (e.g., Python) for hardware control/automation and data analysis
You’d be a great fit with: 
Ph.D. or higher in Engineering or Physics
2+ years of experience leading technical projects focused on micro-fabricated device characterization and development
2+ years of experience in industry working within a team focused on setting and meeting technical goals and deadlines for product delivery
Experience working with ultra-high-vacuum (UHV) assemblies
Experience with cryogenics
Experience using micro-fabricated device and materials analysis tools and techniques, such as SEM, TEM, XPS, SIMS, EDS
Experience using 3D CAD tools (e.g., Solidworks)
Experience with failure mode and effects analysis (FMEA)

position: Senior Manager, Software Engineering, Automation & Calibration
title: Senior Manager, Software Engineering, Automation & Calibration
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.
 We are looking for a Senior Software Engineering Manager to lead the team that builds the software routines and tools for the bringup, calibration, and automation of all of our quantum computers—think of this role as stewarding the userspace applications that run on top of our core OS. You’ll be responsible for helping hire, grow, and coordinate the team of engineers that supports the construction and automation of each new quantum computer.
Responsibilities:
Ensure high quality, scalable, well-tested software through architecture and code reviews
Provide technical expertise in building robust and well-engineered software solutions
Grow a team of Software Engineers with expertise in calibrating and automating our quantum computers
Effectively self-manage technical roadmaps, multiple projects, priorities, deadlines, and deliverables
Identify, track and mitigate execution roadblocks and technical risks
Assist in the career development of others, including performance assessments for mid-year and end-of-year reviews, and providing mentorship on advanced technical issues
Work with cross-functional teams to ensure that each of our quantum computers is fully automated and high quality throughout its lifecycle
Provide clear, concise communication to management, product development teams, and customers
Collaborate and communicate with physicists, designers, electrical engineers, external vendors, and other software engineering managers
Drive continuous improvement to an established product development process
The ideal candidate will have experience leading or contributing to multiple simultaneous initiatives, balancing multiple activities with a keen eye for prioritizing for the biggest impact. You’ll be able to balance technical expertise and savvy with strong business judgment to make great technology choices with lasting impact. You’ll strive for simplicity and demonstrate significant creativity and incisive judgment. You'll enjoy learning technical topics, working across multiple business streams, and be uniquely positioned to help us reach the next horizon in secure quantum computing.
In your first three months, you’ll be helping hire key staff to scale this function.
You’d be a good fit with: 
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, or related field, or equivalent practical experience
5+ years of hands-on technical leadership and people management experience
10+ years programming experience in a general-purpose programming language (like Python, TypeScript, Go, Rust, or C++)
A deep understanding of statistics
Experience in working with technical experts outside of traditional software engineering, particularly electrical engineers and physicists
Knowledge of team management best practices and demonstrated experience building and scaling effective teams that drives a high performance culture in a hybrid work environment
Empathy: you'll work closely with our internal team of physicists who depend on our software every day 
Sound project management, analytical skills and ability to establish metrics to measure and drive a high return on investment
You’d be a great fit with: 
MS or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, or a related degree
10+ years of hands-on technical leadership and people management experience
3+ years in machine learning and/or mathematical optimization
A background in digital signal processing and/or control theory
Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a 15 minute metro ride from Washington DC. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. However, IonQ will be expanding into additional geographies both domestically and internationally so don’t let this stop you from applying.

position: Senior Manager, Software Engineering, Quantum Operating Systems
title: Senior Manager, Software Engineering, Quantum Operating Systems
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.
 We are looking for a Senior Manager, Software Engineering to lead the development of the core of our quantum operating system, in partnership with our principal engineers. Never worked on a quantum operating system? It’s much like a robot operating system, managing feedback loops between sensors and actuators at various time scales to precisely tune an environment where we can perform high fidelity quantum computations. In this role, you’ll help hire, grow, and coordinate our quantum OS team, helping us continue to build the world’s best quantum computers.
The ideal candidate will have experience leading or contributing to multiple simultaneous initiatives, balancing multiple activities with a keen eye for prioritizing for the biggest impact. You’ll be able to balance technical expertise and savvy with strong business judgment to make great technology choices with lasting impact. You’ll strive for simplicity and demonstrate significant creativity and incisive judgment. You'll enjoy learning technical topics, working across multiple business streams, and be uniquely positioned to help us reach the next horizon in secure quantum computing.
Responsibilities:
Ensure high quality, scalable, well-tested software through architecture and code reviews
Provide technical expertise in building robust and well-engineered software solutions
Own the engineering roadmap for your team
Grow a team of Software Engineers with deep expertise working with hardware and automation
Lead the team through identification and negotiation of product scope and schedule
Effectively self-manage technical roadmaps, multiple projects, priorities, deadlines, and deliverables
Identify, track and mitigate execution roadblocks and technical risks
Assist in the career development of others, including performance assessments for mid-year and end-of-year reviews, and providing mentorship on advanced technical issues
Work with cross-functional teams to make forward-looking engineering choices, between the cloud platform that feeds jobs to our OS and the real-time subsystem that executes programs on behalf of the OS
Provide clear, concise communication to management, product development teams, and customers
Collaborate and communicate with physicists, designers, electrical engineers, external vendors, and other software engineering managers
Drive continuous improvement to an established product development process
In your first three months, you’ll be helping hire key staff to scale this function, and defining the technical vision for the next year—and beyond
You’d be a good fit with: 
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, or related field, or equivalent practical experience
5+ years of hands-on technical leadership and people management experience
10+ years programming experience in Go, Rust, or C++, or similar systems-level programming language
Comfort in resource-constrained, multithreaded execution environments
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proven working experience with highly-structured data
Experience in working with technical experts outside of traditional software engineering, particularly electrical engineers and physicists
Knowledge of team management best practices and demonstrated experience building and scaling effective teams
Empathy and customer focus: you'll work closely with our internal team of physicists who depend on our software every day 
You’d be a great fit with: 
MS or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statics, Physics, Electrical Engineering or a related degree
10+ years of hands-on technical leadership and people management experience
Experience with embedded systems
A background in robotics, digital signal processing, control theory, machine learning and/or mathematical optimization
Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a 15 minute metro ride from Washington DC. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. However, IonQ will be expanding into additional geographies both domestically and internationally so don’t let this stop you from applying.
 
At IonQ, we believe in fair treatment, access, opportunity and advancement for all, while at the same time striving to identify and eliminate barriers. We empower employees to thrive by fostering a culture of autonomy, productivity, and respect. title: Senior Engineer, Packaging
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.
 IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.
We are looking for a Senior Packaging Engineer to lead the design, development, and characterization of our current and future trapped-ion package systems, which serve as the heart of IonQ’s quantum computers.  In this role, you will  work with a diverse team of electronic and optical packaging engineers, thermal and mechanical engineers, and FMEA engineers dedicated to this goal.  In addition, you will work closely with other quantum system leads, defining subsystem interfaces and exploring design-space constraints and tradeoffs to optimize full-quantum-computer-system performance.  
Responsibilities:
Lead the mechanical design, development, and characterization of novel ion-trap-module consisting of electrical and optical packaging techniques
Coordinate the full packaging development lifecycle of novel hybrid optical and electronic systems; including detailed design, creation of statements of work for internal and external activities, procurement of components and materials, characterization and testing, and validation.
Coordinate with other quantum system leads to define and explore subsystem interfaces and constraints
Scope and set objectives for new technical projects centered on thermo-mechanical packaging analysis
Guide the technical direction of projects and work with your team to develop and implement creative technical solutions to challenging problems
Develop project timelines, identifying key decision dates and completion dates
Monitor project performance to understand impacts to cost, schedule, and technical performance; actively prioritize deliverables: determine critical path amongst cross-functional deliverables
Conduct risk analysis and develop mitigation plans to ensure on-time release and delivery of project deliverables
Assist with the transition from research and development to production, including development of first articles and technology demonstrations
You'd be a good fit with :
Bachelors or higher in Engineering or relevant field/discipline
5+ years of hands-on electronics or optics device packaging experience, especially with systems which undergo stress cycling
5+ years leading a high-precision packaging development effort in industry
Experience with FMEA

position: Senior Staff Software Engineer, Data Services
title: Senior Staff Software Engineer, Data Services
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.
 We are looking for a Senior Staff Software Engineer to help build our next-generation quantum operating system. Never worked on a quantum operating system? It’s much like an operating system for a robot, managing feedback loops at various time scales between sensors and actuators to create a precisely tuned environment where we can perform high fidelity quantum computations—and keeping track of complex, rapidly-changing state over time is critical to making it all possible. In this role, you’ll help build our OS’s data management layer, helping us build the world’s best quantum computers.
As a Senior Staff Software Engineer focused on data services for our quantum operating system, you will…
Get hands on:
Lead, design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve major software components, systems, and features; being a small team, we count on each other to run with projects independently
Write high-quality, well-tested, production-ready code in Rust and other languages
Develop testing infrastructure for automated verification and validation
Lead:
Assist in the career development of others, providing mentorship on advanced technical issues
Engage:
Collaborate with an experienced interdisciplinary staff
Approach problems pragmatically
Help us continuously improve how we do things
The ideal candidate will have experience leading or contributing to multiple simultaneous product development efforts, projects, and initiatives. You’ll be able to balance technical expertise and savvy with strong business judgment to make great technology choices. You’ll strive for simplicity and demonstrate significant creativity and incisive judgment.
In your first three months, you’ll help build the data engine at the core of our next-generation operating system.
You’d be a good fit with:
Bachelor’s degree in Physics, Engineering, or Computer Science background, or equivalent practical experience—untraditional backgrounds are welcome here
10+ years experience in software development in one or more general-purpose programming languages (like Rust, Go, or C++)
Proven working experience with persisting, querying, and serving highly-structured data in a mix of:
RDBMS (PostgreSQL preferred) via ORM (Go preferred)
time series DBs (Influx Data's TICK stack preferred)
structured document stores (MongoDB preferred)
Solid background in authoring relational schemas with focus on normalization and query optimization
Comfortable with developing for multithreaded execution
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
A love of collaborating in an interdisciplinary environment
Empathy: you'll work closely with our internal team of physicists who depend on our software every day 
You’d be a great fit with:
Master’s degree or PhD in Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, or related technical field
Deep expertise in Go and Rust
Prior work with high-performant, multi-threaded, real-time code; microcontrollers or embedded operating systems; and relational, document and time-series DBs
Strong data analysis skills; the ability to derive insights from data to make decisions
Machine learning experience
Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a 15 minute metro ride from Washington DC. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies.
