title:
This job has expired on Indeed
Reasons could include: the employer is not accepting applications, is not actively hiring, or is reviewing applications
description:
At Atom Computing, we’re building quantum computers with atomic arrays of optically-trapped neutral atoms, empowering researchers and companies to achieve unprecedented breakthroughs. Join an incredible team of scientists, engineers, and business professionals to advance the state of the art in quantum technologies that will transform computing performance.

We are seeking an experienced Linux Systems Administrator to grow our IT team in Boulder, CO. Help support our Quantum Engineers as they hold atoms in place with lasers. You’ll get a chance to build new methods of managing and deploying laptops in an effective, efficient way. We need fresh perspectives for keeping web services under control. We want someone who can wrangle today’s technology waves, so our team can invent the future of quantum computing. If you like helping people, fixing networks, building laptops, all while wearing laser safety goggles, we want to hear from you!

Our Linux Administrator is a user-focused role to help support our offices in Berkeley, CA, and Boulder, CO, as well as our remote employees. We are looking for someone who can naturally assist technical engineers in resolving their computing questions. The focus is on Linux, and cloud services. You will be in a fast-paced, start-up environment, supporting highly technical scientists and engineers as we build the future.

This role requires a person experienced with the implementation and automation of Linux and Windows devices, SaaS apps, but just as critically, someone who empathizes with their fellow co-workers’ needs. If you’re a techie who likes helping people, this job is for you. You look down upon platform bias, imaging and doing one-off manual fixes/builds. You look forward to practical solutions, automation, and unearthing a better way.
Your primary responsibilities will be:
Help design, implement, and maintain a flexible IT infrastructure for scientists, engineers, and business teams.
Ubuntu Linux laptop and server administration & troubleshooting.
Assist with implementation & support of Linux management environment.
Experience with OS and application patches and updates for on-prem or remote clients.
Experience implementing SaaS tools such as Okta, GSuite, 365, Asana, Slack, AWS, etc.
Implement security methods, permissions controls, procedures, monitoring, etc.
Monitor, alert, and report on server or network hardware status.
Clearly communicate and document methodologies to your IT Director.
User education and training for more efficiently utilizing implemented technologies.
Onboarding and offboarding of employees.
Excellent team-oriented focus.
Comfortable resolving complex problems involving multiple stakeholders.
Plus: Network management such as wifi troubleshooting, subnets, etc.
Qualifications:
Ability to leverage your technical knowledge with a friendly co-worker focus.
2+ years in an IT support role.
College degree a plus, Computer Science or other technical focus a double plus.
Experience and/or certification in administering SaaS environments including API usage.
Familiarity with SAML and SCIM implementations.
Familiarity setting up directories such as LDAP or Active Directory.
Formal training or certification in Information Technology or relevant industry experience.
Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal skills.
Demonstrated scripting experience: Shell, Python, or equivalent.
Solid Windows or Mac troubleshooting knowledge is a plus.
Awareness of good digital security practices.
Technical certifications are a plus.
Atom Computing provides a wide variety of perks and benefits, including fully paid medical, dental, and vision insurance for our employees and their dependents. Additionally, we offer unlimited paid time off, 401K company matching, short- and long-term disability, FSA, dependent care benefits, and life insurance. We also offer drinks, snacks, and catered team lunches in our offices, every day!

The salary range for this position is between $80,000 - $110,000, commensurate with experience.

Atom Computing is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to Workplace Diversity.

position: Staff Engineer, Vacuum and Advanced Packaging
title: Staff Engineer, Vacuum and Advanced Packaging
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.
 IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution. 
We are looking for a Staff Engineer, Vacuum and Advanced Packaging to develop novel vacuum technology for our next generation quantum computers. As a Staff Engineer, you’ll be part of a cross-functional team whose mission is to lead IonQ on its journey to build the world’s best quantum computers to solve the world’s most complex problems. 
IonQ R&D team develops groundbreaking new approaches and technology that can change the landscape of how future quantum computers will be designed, manufactured and deployed. As Staff engineers in this role, you will be developing novel ways to reliably create extreme high vacuum (XHV) environment within which future trapped ion quantum computers can be constructed. We are looking for inventive engineers who has a strong track record of thinking outside the box to successfully bring new technologies into innovative products.
Responsibilities:
Lead the R&D effort to developing innovative design, implementation and validation of  new approaches to creating XHV environments
Collaborate closely with other engineering teams to develop, engineer and mature XHV solutions that fit IonQ’s future quantum computers
Engineering process development and documentation for design, construction, test and characterization of XHV chambers
Hands-on thermal/mechanical modeling/simulation of XHV chambers under various operating conditions
Coordinate testing of ion trap operation within the XHV environment
Material and component sourcing, vendor relations and supply chain management for the XHV solutions
You’d be a good fit with:
B.S. degree in Engineering, Materials Science, Physics or other relevant disciplines
7+ years of hands-on experience in research, development or engineering of relevant hardware technology, such as vacuum system design, materials processing, and mechanical engineering
Expertise in XHV/UHV technologies such as materials issues, surface chemistry, vacuum pumps, vacuum gauges, conductance analysis, etc.
Experience in mechanical design and materials processing, such as welding, brazing, soldering, etc.
Must have strong communication skills to discuss system and engineering requirements, engineering solutions, testing strategies and data analysis with other R&D and engineering teams within the company
Must have strong organizational, time management, data analysis and task prioritization abilities along with initiative, analytical skills, teamwork and good judgment. 
You’d be a great fit with:
Advanced degree (MS, Ph.D., etc.) and/or research experience in engineering, materials science, physics or related disciplines
10+ years of either research or industry experience in novel vacuum solutions
Experience working with laser systems, atomic physics or ion traps
Experience designing and building XHV/UHV pumps, gauges or related equipment
Experience developing or working with UHV-related components, such as electrical and other feedthroughs, optical windows, etc.
Project management skills with experience in defining and fulfilling project goals, managing and meeting project timelines and/or customer commitments, and budget management

Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a five-minute walk from the Metro. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. title: Computational Chemistry Incubation Lead
description:
The Microsoft Strategic Missions and Technologies division focuses on next-generation technology solutions, including specialized teams empowering telecommunications providers; engineering teams who are helping to carry out challenging missions and connecting the cloud to satellites in space; worldwide research teams leading the way to scalable, accessible quantum computing; and the key technology partner to the U.S. Federal government for achieving their diverse organizations’ missions through digital transformation.
Come be a part of SMT’s recently created Growth Innovation and Strategy team, responsible for delivering inspirational experiences and visionary thought leadership, high value scenarios, programs, and growth strategy & planning across our innovative portfolio driving the next new business categories and revenue streams in Microsoft.
We’re looking for a Senior Product Manager to lead the incubation of a computational chemistry solution that brings together the scale of Azure HPC, state-of-the-art ML models, and Azure Quantum.
Responsibilities
Responsibilities include:
Thought Leadership:
Develop, test and land differentiated and durable value propositions
Sustain an engine of audience research to inform strategic decisions across marketing, PR, and engineering.
Drive storytelling strategy for use cases and scenarios and execute a clear content strategy spanning multiple stakeholders

Subject Matter Expertise:
Act as subject matter expert to bring to life the vision for advanced computational chemistry
Drive customer and community engagements in partnership with the Customer Engagement team both at a business and technical levels.
Lead a competitive analysis motion to provide ongoing intelligence to the engineering, marketing, and customer engagement teams

Industry engagement:
Define and develop new use cases and scenarios in partnership with engineering that span Quantum Computing, HPC, ML, and other breakthrough technologies
Help define and shape the product strategy through deep industry knowledge and customer-facing engagements
Qualifications
Required
Undergraduate degree
7+ years of relevant experience in product marketing, product development and/or program management
3+ years of experience within the computational chemistry industry
3+ years of experience in HPC and ML projects

Preferred
Familiarity with Quantum Computing
Entrepreneurial spirit fueled by a deep understanding of innovation spaces and emerging technologies
Strong strategic and creative thinking skills
Comfortable dealing with ambiguity and complexity
Intellectually curious and able to see things from different points of view
Ability to absorb complex technical and scientific information and creatively distill into key takeaways, crisp analyses, presentations, and narratives
Highly collaborative and able to build trusting relationships across multiple stakeholders
Strong interpersonal skills, with prior experience working across multiple teams and functions, with the ability to effectively support management of stakeholders internally and externally
Work on multiple assignments at once while meeting timelines
Ability to work independently but know when to ask for guidance

The salary for this role in the state of Colorado is between $129,800 and $194,800.

In addition, certain roles also have the opportunity to earn sales incentives based on revenue or utilization, depending on the terms of the plan and the employee’s role"

title: Staff Physicist, R&D
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.
 IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution. 
We are looking for Applied and Theoretical Physicists (all levels) to support a variety of R&D projects. As a member of the R&D organization, you will be part of a cross-functional team whose mission is to lead IonQ on its journey to build the world’s best quantum computers to solve the world’s most complex problems. 
In this role you’ll work alongside physicists, scientists, optical engineers, mechanical engineers, software engineers, and device fabrication experts to tackle the next generation of quantum computing problems. You will support a variety of efforts, ranging from novel quantum gate technology to system scaling, photonic interconnects and integrated circuits, advanced optomechanical systems, novel packaging, gate protocol and quantum algorithm development, and advanced ion trap technology.
Responsibilities:
Conduct independent and collaborative R&D to support the current and next generation of world’s best quantum computers 
Work closely with system and design engineers to develop integrated solutions for the next generation of quantum computers, leveraging analysis, experimental results, simulation, and physical understanding to inform designs  
Theoretically and numerically model quantum computer system behavior based on realistic error processes
Contribute to the design, build, and operation of R&D ion traps, laser, electronics, and other systems and platforms
Assist with the transition of technology from R&D to production, including development of first articles and technology demonstrations.
Mentor and technically assist other engineers and scientists
You’d be a good fit with:
Masters degree in Applied or Theoretical Physics, Engineering, or related field
Experience in applying research to relevant industry problems 
Demonstrated theoretical or experimental experience with one or more of the following specialties: atomic physics systems, diffraction limited optical systems, high power lasers (from UV to IR), quantum circuits, quantum algorithms and/or quantum error correction, quantum information science, atomic clocks, vacuum systems
Detailed understanding and laboratory experience with experimental equipment, tools, processes and/or systems
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
A love of collaborating in an interdisciplinary environment
You’d be a great fit with:
Ph.D. degree in Applied or Theoretical Physics, Engineering, or related field
3+ years experience in applying research to relevant industry problems 
Prior experience with trapped ion systems (or neutral atom systems), photonics, or quantum computing
Familiarity with atomic physics systems and applications, or quantum information science
Demonstrated experience with engineering or analysis languages such as C++, FORTRAN, MATLAB, or Python

position: Technical Project Manager - Quantum Machine Learning
title: Technical Project Manager - Quantum Machine Learning
description:
We are expanding the Machine Learning and Quantum Algorithms team with a Project Manager. In this role you will be responsible for supporting and managing technical client projects that apply quantum computing to use cases in machine learning, optimisation and simulation.

You will support scientific project managers in formulating technical project proposals, reporting progress and preparing technical workshops. Your enthusiasm for quantum computing applications will help you shape projects through their full lifecycle, often supporting the business development team from pre-sales stage through to delivery with client-facing interaction.

This role is embedded in a team of applied scientists and researchers. The team focuses on making the most of today’s quantum computers with innovative quantum algorithms and a view towards early applications developed in collaboration with some of the largest global enterprises.
Key responsibilities
Prepare and lead technical client meetings and workshops
Support scientific project managers in formulating proposals, statements of work, technical presentations
Prepare and document project status meetings, support project progress reporting
Support applied researchers in compiling technical and scientific project reports
Develop and maintain tools and processes for project tracking, milestones, deliverables
Distil and contextualise quantum computing research for non-specialist audience
You must have
Masters degree in physics, mathematics, computer science or related field
Significant experience with quantum computing and its use cases through degree work, research, hackathons, etc.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Enthusiasm for client-facing interactions
Preferred qualifications
PhD related to quantum computing
2+ years of experience in a consulting or professional services role with a track record of delivering technical projects
Hands-on experience with quantum algorithms for machine learning, optimisation and simulation
Experience with project management, e.g. PMI, PRINCE2 etc.
What is in it for you?
Working alongside a highly talented team, with leading names in the quantum computing industry. We offer a highly competitive package, equity, 28 days of paid holiday (in addition to public holidays), a workplace pension, a positive approach to flexible working and enhanced parental and adoption benefits.

About Us:

Science Led and Enterprise Driven. 

Our team of scientists is leading the way in the development of quantum computing. The world’s largest integrated quantum computing company, we united Cambridge Quantum’s advanced software development with Honeywell Quantum Solutions’ high-fidelity hardware to accelerate quantum computing. With full-stack technology, we’re scaling quantum computing and developing applications to solve the world’s most pressing challenges. We could be even better with you!

At Quantinuum, we believe quantum information systems will revolutionize the way we work and live. We are leading the way by helping our customers develop quantum-enabled solutions that provide a competitive-edge in their markets. 

We’re hiring the world’s best talent to make it happen. Join us! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ErQOKNC2O38  

Please note that employment with us is subject to successfully passing our pre-employment screening checks. We are an inclusive equal opportunity employer. You will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.
APPLY FOR THIS JOB

location: Location: Woodland Hills, California, United States of America
title: Sr. Principal Atomic Physicist
description:
At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

Northrop Grumman Mission Systems is a trusted provider of mission-enabling solutions for global security.  Our Engineering and Sciences (E&S) organization pushes the boundaries of innovation, redefines engineering capabilities, and drives advances in various sciences. Our team is chartered with providing the skills, innovative technologies to develop, design, produce and sustain optimized product lines across the sector while providing a decisive advantage to the warfighter.  Come be a part of our mission!
We are looking for you to join our team as a Atomic Physicist/Scientist based out of Woodland Hills, CA. As a Atomic Physicist/Scientist at Northrop Grumman you will have a challenging and rewarding opportunity to be a part of our Enterprise-wide digital transformation. Through the use of Model-based Engineering, DevSecOps and Agile practices we continue to evolve how we deliver critical national defense products and capabilities for the warfighter.  Our success is grounded in our ability to embrace change, move quickly and continuously drive innovation.  The successful candidate will be collaborative, open, transparent, and team-oriented with a focus on team empowerment & shared responsibility, flexibility, continuous learning, and a culture of automation.
What You’ll get to Do:
The Future Position, Navigation, and Timing Systems (FPNTS) team at Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) is looking for you to join our team as an Atomic Physicist/Scientist based out of Woodland Hills, CA. The Physicist/Scientist will join an active research and development group focused on applications in atomic and quantum sensing of geophysical phenomena. Applications of interest include accelerometers, clocks, electrometers, gravity gradiometers, gyroscopes, magnetometers, RF sensors, and acoustic sensors. They will collaborate on current sensor development projects and help develop new concepts and approaches for future investigations, working closely with a team of engineers and technicians and coordinate their efforts to insure that the system design and implementation is appropriate for the physics of the system. With expectations to work on efforts ranging in maturity from fundamental basic research, often coordinating with a university research group, and proof of principle demonstrations through to middle and late stage research and development, and support transition to production.
Collaborate in a team environment and be able to fill the principal investigator role on both internal and contract funded research efforts.
Utilize strong public speaking skill and communicate complex technical information to both subject matter experts and laymen.
Be able to train and mentor other team members in the specific technical details of new and inventive sensing systems, and translate developing sensor physics into meaningful specifications and requirements for the mechanical, electrical, and systems designs.
Attend and actively support scientific and technical conferences, symposia, workshops, working team meetings and other venues for presentations of results and development of collaborative research relationships and business development.
Atomic sensor development program execution.
New concept and program pursuits.
Sensor development planning and road mapping.
Team development and mentoring.
Collaboration and support on related as well as outside of expertise projects.
Lead both internal and contract research and development efforts.
Present research and results to customers and the scientific community through conferences, technical interchange meetings, and journal publications.
NGFeaturedJobs
Basic Qualifications:
BS in Physics or equivalent STEM field with 9 years of relevant experience; MS in Physics or equivalent STEM field with 7 years of relevant experience; Ph.D. in Physics or equivalent STEM field with 4 years of relevant experience.
Must possess a demonstrated track record of innovation and accomplishment in atomic/quantum system and/or sensor development.
Knowledge of atomic sensing principles.
Excellent written and oral communication skills Self-motivated, capable of working independently and leading a team.
US Citizenship is required in order to obtain and maintain security clearance
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working Government-funded R&D programs.
Proficiency with Mathematica, LabView, Solidworks, Comsol, C/C++, Python, MATLAB/Simulink, VHDL.
Knowledge of principles of navigation, including inertial navigation and aided navigation.
Experience with atomic clocks, magnetometers, gyroscopes, and/or accelerometers.
Experience with spin polarized atomic systems and vapor cell based sensor physics.
Experience with cold/ultra-cold (BEC) systems and atom interferometry based measurements and sensors.

Experience designing, modifying, or tuning analog/digital electronics.
Experience with finite element analysis.
Experience with mechanical design, fabrication/machining, additive manufacturing, and component assembly.
Experience with ultra-high vacuum systems.

title: Infrastructure Engineer - On Prem
description:
About Xanadu
Xanadu’s mission is to build quantum computers that are useful and available to people everywhere.
At Xanadu, we are learners, innovators, researchers, collaborators and problem solvers. We are creating something that has never been built before. Few people in their life will be able to be a part of something like this, where if we are successful, the technologies we develop will solve some of the world’s most challenging problems, and literally change the world. And that is something to be excited about!
We are looking for a talented Infrastructure Specialist to join us as we scale our growing start-up.
Your role and responsibilities:
Reporting into our DevOps Lead, this position will responsible for maintaining and automating the on-premise Linux based Infrastructure used to run our state-of-the-art Quantum Hardware Engineering lab.
Key Responsibilities:
• Installs, configures, documents, creates and maintains assigned operating system(s) hardware & software. Works continuously to automate as much as can be using Ansible playbooks.
• Maintains assigned system security and backup / recovery procedures.
• Troubleshoots problems associated with our on-premise infrastructure
• Provides recommendations for hardware and systems software
• Develops, tests, and documents disaster recovery and business continuity plans.
• Perform system maintenance, configuration, and schedule regular upgrades
What We’re Looking For :
• A strong working background in Linux as well as scripting
• Experience automating Linux-based infrastructure using Ansible
• Basic knowledge of SQL Database maintenance and use
• Previous experience with Open Source Software & Configuration
• Experience with any of the following are definite assets : Docker Containers, Kubernetes, POS applications, Google Cloud Platform
• Excellent communication skills both in verbal and written correspondence
Required Qualifications and Experience:
5+ years work experience in a similar role; Exposure to automation using Ansible is a must
Versatile (and keen) - able to jump into whatever needs to be done.
Computer Science/Computer Engineering degree/diploma
Strong communication skills

position: Quantum Error Correction Research Software Developer
title: Quantum Error Correction Research Software Developer
description:
About Xanadu
Xanadu’s mission is to build quantum computers that are useful and available to people everywhere.
At Xanadu, we are learners, innovators, researchers, collaborators and problem solvers. We are creating something that has never been built before. Few people in their life will be able to be a part of something like this, where if we are successful, the technologies we develop will solve some of the world’s most challenging problems, and literally change the world. And that is something to be excited about!
Your Role and Responsibilities:
In this role you will be focusing on the software aspects of fault-tolerant quantum computation, especially using bosonic, measurement-based, photonic architectures. The main goal will be to develop highly optimized numerical code for running large-scale simulations of quantum computation for the purpose of benchmarking, resource counting, and obtaining fault-tolerant thresholds. To this end you will use, design, develop, and optimize parallelization techniques as well as simulation algorithms. The work will also involve investigations of compilation and decoding algorithms, including new implementations and improvements to existing implementations.
Required Skills and Experience:
To succeed in this role, you should have the following:
Strong familiarity with quantum computation and quantum error correction, including various noise models, codes, and decoders
Strong experience programming in Python
Some experience programming in low-level languages (e.g., C, C++, Fortran)
Experience with high-level scientific programming frameworks in Python
Experience working with multiprocessing and parallelized code
Experience with development of numerical / approximation techniques
Ability to convert abstract descriptions of algorithms into efficient code implementations
Experience with software engineering best practices: testing, continuous integration, version control, documentation, and code review
Familiarity with and experience working in a fast-growing technology start-up environment
Great communication skills; can express complex technical concepts in a clear and easy to understand way
Preferred Skills and Experience:
Familiarity with measurement-based quantum computation, quantum optics, and bosonic codes
Experience with scientific computing on HPC, supercomputer, and cluster-grade hardware
Experience with scientific computing on commodity / cloud hardware (e.g., AWS)
Knowledge of CPU instruction sets, GPU programming, and compilation
Ability to convert high-level language scripts to optimized low-level implementations (e.g., C, C++, Fortran) with optimization (SIMD vectorization) and parallelization (OpenMP, threading)
Experience with binding high-level scripting languages to low-level implementations
Ability to aggressively optimize algorithm efficiency at every part of the computational stack
Familiarity with distributed computation
PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, or Engineering an asset
Qualifications:
BSc or MSc in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, or Engineering with relevant industry experience preferred, or equivalent combination of education and experience
5+ years of experience working in related fields
Proven track record delivering highly optimized numerical algorithms
Values
Our values are important. They are fundamental and lay the foundation for culture at Xanadu. Learn more about our values here. 
At Xanadu, we are committed to building an inclusive, safe, and equitable culture and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. We are committed to meeting the needs of all individuals and support a barrier-free workplace. Should you require accommodations at any point during the recruitment process please contact Human Resources at hr@xanadu.ai.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Developer Relations
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.
 Quantum computers don’t program themselves—indeed, programming quantum computers is so different than programming classical computers that it’s said there may be less than 200 people in the world who really know how to create novel quantum algorithms. We need an experienced Senior Developer Relations Engineer to help us grow the community of quantum software developers generally, and IonQ quantum platform developers specifically. We believe delivering truly great developer experiences is essential to help unleash quantum computing’s awesome potential for the world. In this role, you’ll be empowered to lead launches and campaigns for developer audiences around key areas such as domain libraries, computing APIs, distributed training, and more, working directly with quantum computing pioneers, leading research institutions, and enterprises.
Responsibilities:
Build the developer relations function at IonQ! You’ll collaborate with developers at conferences, hackathons, and online, helping both build community and advocate for our developers’ needs
Work with leadership and cross-functional teams to set directions for our quantum compute platform and integrations
Help plan event and developer marketing strategies
Work with our engineering, product, and marketing teams to improve our products by sharing feedback, reviewing API designs and testing new capabilities across our language-agnostic stack 
Help develop the future of quantum programming as you grow our community of developers, magnifying the impact of quantum computing on the world
Own building and distributing content relevant to educate and nurture the developer audience 
Define creative and effective ways to communicate the latest innovations - demo, presentations, infographics, etc
Synthesize conversations with developers into actionable insights to shape product plans and report best practices with cross-functional teams
You’d be a good fit with:
BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience
5+ years experience in developer relations
3+ years experience in leadership or people management
Prior experience building/running a developer relations team
Great people and communication skills, whether writing blog posts or giving presentations
A love of mentorship
Experience in Python
You’d be a great fit with:
An educational or professional background in quantum information science, physics, or mathematics
Existing relationships in the quantum field
Familiarity with one or more major quantum programming kits (Cirq, Penny Lane, ProjectQ, Qiskit)
Experience building and executing long-term strategies to improve developer experience
Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a 15 minute metro ride from Washington DC. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. However, IonQ will be expanding into additional geographies both domestically and internationally so don’t let this stop you from applying.
 
At IonQ, we believe in fair treatment, access, opportunity and advancement for all, while at the same time striving to identify and eliminate barriers. We empower employees to thrive by fostering a culture of autonomy, productivity, and respect. We are dedicated to creating an environment  in which any individual can feel welcomed, respected, supported and valued.
 
We are committed to equity and justice. We welcome different voices and viewpoints and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, age, sexual orientation, and military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.
 
If you are interested in being a part of this team and mission, we encourage you to apply.
IonQ Covid-19 Policy: IonQ requires all employees to provide proof of full vaccination for Covid-19 before starting employment.

title: Staff Software Engineer, Quantum Tools
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.
 Our quantum computing platform is front-end agnostic—we’d like to support all quantum programming kits and libraries so that our customers can bring the tools they’re most comfortable with to program our devices. In this role, you’ll be building the software that makes that possible!
As a staff software engineer with a focus on quantum programming tools, you will be expected to...
Get hands on:
Own our Qiskit and Cirq integrations as we grow our platform and user base
Become a master at the art of getting the most out of a quantum computing hardware platform
Lead:
Design and build new internal tools for interacting with our APIs and programming our quantum computers
Engage:
Get involved with the quantum programming community at large by participating in community meetings, Slacks, hackathons, and conferences
Contribute to open source projects that our customers and teams rely on
Help our customers succeed with great documentation and onboarding
You’ll be building the tools that enable our customers to program our quantum computers. This is an opportunity for a senior software engineer with an emerging or existing interest in quantum computing to bring their diverse background and talents into the future. Alternatively this is an opportunity for a quantum researcher with strong software engineering skills to engage in building the tooling to make quantum computer research faster and more productive. We’d love a blend of hands-on experience as well as tactical and strategic direction.
In your first three months, you’ll be helping update our Qiskit, Cirq, Penny Lane, and ProjectQ libraries to support new capabilities.
You’d be a good fit with:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Physics, or equivalent practical experience—untraditional backgrounds are welcome and encouraged!
10+ years proficient programming expertise in a general-purpose language like Python
5+ years experience building programming libraries and/or SDKs
Prior experience with quantum computing or quantum information science
A history of open source contributions, ideally to quantum computing libraries or related
You’d be a great fit with:
Master’s degree in Computer Science or Quantum Information Science
Prior experience in developer relations or advocacy
IBM’s Qiskit Developer certificate (but we realize basically nobody does yet)
A history of maintaining open source projects
Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform and RESTful APIs
Excitement to learn and get things done right
Empathy for your internal and external customers and excellent communication skills, since you’ll be working with folks of all backgrounds—technical and non-technical alike
Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a 15 minute metro ride from Washington DC. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. However, IonQ will be expanding into additional geographies both domestically and internationally so don’t let this stop you from applying.
 
At IonQ, we believe in fair treatment, access, opportunity and advancement for all, while at the same time striving to identify and eliminate barriers. We empower employees to thrive by fostering a culture of autonomy, productivity, and respect. We are dedicated to creating an environment  in which any individual can feel welcomed, respected, supported and valued.

We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.
 
If you are interested in being a part of this team and mission, we encourage you to apply.

description:
In this role, you will be part of the group that develops, maintains and supports our flagship cybersecurity platform. You will work closely with your colleagues to design and implement new features, as well as troubleshooting issues and solving problems. You will undertake other related tasks that are typical for a software engineer. This will involve collaborating closely with our internal architects, establishing testing pipelines for new software, etc. Your manager is technical and
Overall, our main development language is C++, and therefore a good understanding of C++ is required. We have different products for different use-cases, with our main product being cloud-based and written in C++ with some Rust. We also have client-based software, again written predominantly in C++.
We maintain CLIs rather than GUIs for our tools, and GUI experience is not required, though naturally if you have experience in this area it would be good to hear it! We use relatively standard development practices that will be familiar to most (Git, Artifactory, Jira for Kanban ticket management). The team generally uses CLion for development, but you can use the tools that are best for you and the task at hand. The software engineering manager comes from a technical background, having previously been a senior software engineer and technical lead themselves, and continues to use this knowledge to support the team.
Job Role and Responsibilities:
Working both independently and as part of the team to develop, maintain and expand Quantinuum’s cybersecurity software suite in a manner typical of a senior software engineer
Adapting to new programming languages and frameworks, as needed. We will support you with formal (paid) and informal (internal) training, including the time to train.
Providing support and guidance to others in areas of technical expertise.
Identifying areas where personal improvement is necessary and working with the Manager to identify suitable training.
Presenting and demonstrating to others on your work and progress.
Taking ownership of projects or parts of projects to ensure effective delivery.
Working with internal stakeholders (Product and Solutions teams) to identify technical requirements for projects.
Working independently, or as part of a team, to design products and integrations.
Ensuring code quality through development of automated tests and participation in peer reviews.
Keeping tickets up-to-date with current status. Creating new tickets as necessary.
Identifying areas of potential improvement throughout our products and work processes, and informing others of your findings.
You may be asked to mentor or guide junior members of the team.
Main skills:
To have the requisite knowledge to perform the duties and responsibilities of the role detailed above.
A strong ability to develop, maintain and expand software, independently and within a team.
A track record of previous successful software development, preferably with experience of working with commercial customers.
A very good working knowledge of C++, as well as good knowledge of Bash and Python to support testing. Experience working with databases, HTTP connections, APIs and other associated skills.
Good knowledge of tools and toolchains that can accelerate and improve software development. This might include Docker, CI/CD tools, Kubernetes, etc.
Familiarity with standard collaboration tools such as Git. Familiarity with setting up or supporting technical tools and pipelines (e.g. CI/CD) to improvement software development.
Experience leading technical discussions on a range of topics.
Good written and verbal communication. The ability to explain complicated topics in an easy-to-understand way.
An active enthusiasm to learn new skills and technologies as needed. We will support you with high-quality training.
Desirable Skills:
A relevant degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or a related discipline, or the knowledge and experience equivalent
Identifying areas of technical knowledge where others may benefit from additional support or training and discussing this privately with the Manager
A good working understanding of…
Cloud deployment technologies, including Kubernetes and Helm
Secure design and secure implementation
Intel SGX technology, including designing, implementing and supporting such code
Azure (preferred), AWS or Google Cloud for setting up virtual machines, deploying networks, etc.
Cryptography, and cryptographic protocols. Designing the use of secure cryptography within a system.
Hardware Security Modules (HSMs), including both technical and non-technical knowledge.
Rust, Go or other languages.
Deploying high-reliability cloud services
Quantum scientific research, and quantum technologies
Entropy generation and analysis

What is in it for you?
Working alongside a highly talented team, with leading names in the quantum computing industry. We offer a highly competitive package, equity, 28 days of paid holiday (in addition to public holidays), a workplace pension, a positive approach to flexible working and enhanced parental and adoption benefits.

About Us:

Science Led and Enterprise Driven.

Our team of scientists is leading the way in the development of quantum computing. The world’s largest integrated quantum computing company, we united Cambridge Quantum’s advanced software development with Honeywell Quantum Solutions’ high-fidelity hardware to accelerate quantum computing. With full-stack technology, we’re scaling quantum computing and developing applications to solve the world’s most pressing challenges. We could be even better with you!

At Quantinuum, we believe quantum information systems will revolutionize the way we work and live. We are leading the way by helping our customers develop quantum-enabled solutions that provide a competitive-edge in their markets.

We’re hiring the world’s best talent to make it happen. Join us! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ErQOKNC2O38

Please note that employment with us is subject to successfully passing our pre-employment screening checks. We are an inclusive equal opportunity employer. You will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

description:
Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities
We are looking to hire a Research Scientist (RS) / Research Staff Member (RSM) in the Theory of Quantum Computing and Information Group at the IBM TJ Watson Research Laboratory in Yorktown Heights, NY. The ideal candidate would have a graduate degree in physics, computer science, mathematics, engineering or a related field and would have several years of research experience in quantum error correction, fault tolerant quantum computing, quantum information, or related areas. This job entails both a high degree of autonomy and the ability to collaborate with others in a research and development environment. Candidates are expected to publish and present high-impact results and to work closely with other members of the team.

This position is located in Yorktown Heights, NY



Required Technical and Professional Expertise

At least 5 years of experience in quantum computing theory
Required Education
Doctorate Degree

At least 5 years research experience in quantum computing, error correction, fault-tolerance, quantum algorithms, or quantum information
Proven record of research and accomplishment.

About Business Unit
IBM Quantum is an industry first initiative to build universal quantum computers for business, engineering and science.
This job requires you to provide your COVID-19 vaccination status with supporting documentation, where legally permissible.

Your Life @ IBM
Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement

Discounts on retail products, services, and experiences.

title: Sales Engineer Quantum Technologies
description:
Qblox is looking for a junior application scientist to help us build industrial-scale quantum computers with our customers. We provide them with quantum control stacks that generate the analog signals needed for the control and readout of quantum bits. In this job you will:
Create new relations and manage existing relations with customers,
Represent Qblox at conferences and visit customers around the world,
Match customers’ requirements with Qblox’s solutions,
(Co-)author sales collateral
Work with the marketing team in creating marketing material (app notes, website, videos),
Connect to our hardware and software teams to improve our user experience,
Help sales/marketing team with regular operations,
Collect, record and maintain customer contact data.

title: Senior HR Manager
description:
Qblox is looking for an HR manager to help us scale the company while maintaining our high-paced team with excellent people and culture. As Qblox HR manager you will play an influential role in developing and supporting our employees from the management of the recruitment process towards their talent development and retention. You will draw on your professional experience to help us expand our world-class team and build Qblox's reputation as an employer of choice. This role is an integral part of a busy, growing business, and we are looking for someone enthusiastic and keen to work with the team and across the company to improve and drive change.
In this job you will:
Ensure the team at Qblox is well-equipped and comfortable with HR and culture-related matters
Manage the employee life cycle activities including talent acquisition, performance management, employee growth,  contracts, offers, onboarding, and offboarding
Maintain and improve HR management software - keeping employee records up to date in a timely manner
Review, amend, create and communicate HR-related policies, principles, handbooks, and process manuals
Oversee  and manage the recruitment process 
Sustain Qblox’s learning and development, including suggesting and arranging any required team training, advising on performance development plans and processes, and attending review meetings.
Be responsible for and drive improvement in diversity, inclusion, and engagement
Be a point of contact for any personable work-related issues (e.g. grievances and employee disputes)

4+ years of professional software development experience
3+ years of programming experience with at least one software programming language
2+ years of experience contributing to the system design or architecture (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems
Experience as a mentor, tech lead OR leading an engineering team

2+ years of experience of developing libraries and/or cryptography services

Job summary Are you passionate about the prospect of keeping millions of customers’ data safe? Do you want to be part of a team bringing the latest innovations in cryptography to market? Are you excited about the challenge of engineering highly scalable systems on the world’s market leading cloud infrastructure? Security is the #1 concern of customers moving to the cloud and the AWS Cryptography team is dedicated to providing the security features our customers need. We enable customers to confidently move sensitive workloads to the cloud where they can benefit from security controls that help meet internal and external compliance requirements. AWS Cryptography is focused on delivering optimized cryptographic algorithms for our customers that raises the bar on security. The Software Developer will be responsible for designing and implementing post-quantum cryptographic algorithms. This includes performance optimization at the assembly-level and CPU-level. Let’s prove that highly performant crypto and security are not mutually exclusive. Come join our team if you want to influence crypto at AWS! Key job responsibilities In this role, you will: • Design and implement post-quantum cryptography for both internal and external customers. • Create simple APIs to access our cryptographic algorithms. • Work with a team of talented Software Development Engineers and Applied Scientists. • Be a committed technical leader who develops and mentors junior engineers. About the team AWS has the most services, and more features within those services, than any other cloud provider – from infrastructure technologies like compute, storage, and databases – to emerging technologies, such as machine learning and artificial intelligence, data lakes and analytics, and Internet of Things. AWS Cryptography builds the services and tools to keep all of our customers’ data secure. AWS Cryptography develops critical software used by AWS service teams and customers including the open source projects AWS-LC, S2N-TLS, and Amazon Corretto Crypto Provider.
Basic knowledge and understanding of cryptography principles
Experience researching or implementing post-quantum cryptographic algorithms
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to convey technical information to a wide variety of audiences.
Experience building applications with AWS core services (EC2, S3, RDS, KMS, etc.)
In-depth hands-on experience in high performance computing with C, C++, or Rust
Technical knowledge of open source crypto libraries, such as AWS-LC, S2N-TLS, Amazon Corretto Crypto Provider, OpenSSL, or BoringSSL.

For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

description:
Introduction
IBM Research Scientists are charting the future of Artificial Intelligence, creating breakthroughs in quantum computing, discovering how blockchain will reshape the enterprise, and much more. Join a team that is dedicated to applying science to some of today's most complex challenges, whether it’s discovering a new way for doctors to help patients, teaming with environmentalists to clean up our waterways or enabling retailers to personalize customer service.

Your Role and Responsibilities
The work location for this role is either Daresbury Labs or Hursley Labs for a minimum of 2 days a week.

You will be part of a highly motivated and skilled team incubating a new business for IBM with the goal of accelerating science and societal impact, focusing especially in chemistry, materials, biomedical sciences, climate, and sustainability. A Research Software Engineer focusing on Enablement and Education collaborates with scientists, engineers, product management, and other team members to enable the ecosystem of effective users on our technologies that drive accelerated discovery and translation to business impact.
In particular,
You will lead efforts to strategically activate in areas focused on education, workforce development, and skills-based programs with clients
You will design, produce and deliver compelling technical education and enablement programming and content, from blogs and explainer videos, to online learning and virtual tutorials, all the way to hands on technical workshop facilitation

You will analyse data and feedback from client interactions to plan strategies for program improvements, and provide strategic insights to support iteration of content and program development
You will support our business development team and recognize opportunities to involve clients more deeply in our research, as well as identify pertinent use-case examples that will resonate with clients from diverse sectors

Experience using relational database management systems (such as Airtable).

About Business Unit
With more than 3,000 researchers in 12 labs located across six continents, IBM Research brings together hundreds of researchers who possess unparalleled industry expertise to address some of the world's most challenging problems. Join us as we do pioneering work in areas such as cognitive computing, augmented intelligence, quantum computing, and blockchain, to name a few.

Your Life @ IBM
Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement

Being You @ IBM

title: Senior Frontend Engineer
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ’s computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.
 We’re proudly supported by investors like GV (Google Ventures), NEA, Amazon, Samsung, Bosch, HP, Airbus, and more.
Our mission is to build the world’s best quantum computers to solve the world’s most complex problems. As a frontend engineer, you’ll be helping scientists program and control our quantum computers, from our cloud platform down to our OS. We’re looking for engineers who love the intersection between great user experiences and the cutting edge of technology.
Responsibilities:
Craft UI components, libraries, interfaces, and tools that our own scientists use to manage our quantum computers and that our customers use to access them
Ensure our UI components are reliable, extensible, and scalable
Help define our frontend technology strategy
Design and implement compelling frontend experiences that appeal to quantum novices and experts alike to promote IonQ's mission
You’d be a good fit with: 
7+ years experience developing responsive web frontends, component libraries, and tools using JavaScript and/or TypeScript
3+ years experience with React 
Experience leading complex technical projects and driving change inside organizations
A passion for working with users, great user experience, and API design
Attention to detail on the web, especially around performance, accessibility, reliability and security
You’d be a great fit with:
BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience or self-study
Experience building tools for developers
A love of writing and maintaining great documentation
Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a 15 minute metro ride from Washington DC. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. However, IonQ will be expanding into additional geographies both domestically and internationally so don’t let this stop you from applying.
 
At IonQ, we believe in fair treatment, access, opportunity and advancement for all, while at the same time striving to identify and eliminate barriers. We empower employees to thrive by fostering a culture of autonomy, productivity, and respect. We are dedicated to creating an environment  in which any individual can feel welcomed, respected, supported and valued.
 
We are committed to equity and justice. We welcome different voices and viewpoints and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, age, sexual orientation, and military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.
 
If you are interested in being a part of this team and mission, we encourage you to apply.
IonQ Covid-19 Policy: IonQ requires all employees to provide proof of full vaccination for Covid-19 before starting employment.

title: Quantum Engineer - Hardware Focus (UK)
description:
Rigetti Computing is developing cloud-deployed quantum computers to solve humanity’s most pressing and valuable problems. We are a highly diverse and interdisciplinary team of scientists and engineers working at the cutting edge of technology in a mission-driven entrepreneurial environment. We believe that bringing together teams from various cultures, educational backgrounds, and technical disciplines helps them to see things from more points of view and to make great products that change the world for the better.

As a Quantum Engineer, you will be a key contributor to our UK Quantum Computing Center. As such, you will work with the team to deploy our first quantum computer in the UK while driving systematic improvements throughout Rigetti Computing’s full-stack quantum computing architecture. 

You will also work in close collaboration with our team in Berkeley CA, USA, to create reliable functionality of the system, outline hardware requirements for the engineering organization, and integrate novel capabilities into our quantum systems. You will elevate physics breakthroughs into stable technology, working closely with a uniquely diverse team of engineers.

description:
Cambridge, UK | Full-time | Permanent
About us
Riverlane is the world’s first quantum engineering company. We are hardware obsessed, qubit agile and commercially driven. We’re a passionate team collaboratively tackling some of humanity’s biggest opportunities, from climate change to materials science and new drug discovery.
You will join our cross-disciplinary team of software developers, mathematicians, quantum information theorists, computational chemists and physicists – all world experts in their fields. Our collaborative, close-knit team has a track record of delivering high-quality R&D across the full quantum stack. As a growing company, you will have the freedom to think independently and creatively, as well as contribute to Riverlane’s business development.
*
About the role*
You will join the interdisciplinary Discover research team, developing algorithms and research code for relevant applications for quantum computers, with a focus on quantum chemistry and solving of linear equations using quantum algorithms. Collaborating and communicating with end-users from academia and industry will be an important part of the role. As a quantum scientist on the Discover team, your input into how quantum computers will be able to solve problems will be central to the success of the team. You will have the opportunity to work across our product portfolio and will be able to contribute to and lead projects as appropriate, pursuing work which best matches your ability and interest whilst developing your knowledge and skills.
Requirements
What you will do
Conduct research, develop algorithms, and write software for quantum computing applications
Communicate results in the form of discussions and presentations to other team members and partners
Build expertise in the field of quantum computing through discussions with colleagues, reading relevant literature and gaining practical experience
Contribute to Riverlane’s international standing through writing scientific papers and presenting results at conferences as appropriate
Interact and work with a wide range of academic and industry partners
Use your knowledge about academic and commercial challenges to shape the research direction of the team
Help develop research and business development proposals to win external funding
Engage with the wider community through writing blogs and developing demonstrations
What we need
PhD (or equivalent industry experience) in a subject related to either quantum information, theoretical physics, quantum chemistry, computer science or mathematics.
Evidence of creative, high-quality academic work
Good programming skills, with a proven capability of understanding technical material and translating it into code
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with a track record of communicating scientific results to colleagues and other audiences
Experience working both independently and in a research team
Desire to learn, with a capacity both to lead and follow
Even better if you have…
Experience in quantum software development and maintenance
Understanding of quantum error correction
Experience in quantum algorithms for fault-tolerant quantum computers
Experience in an application area such as Finance, Quantum Machine Learning, Cryptanalysis, Quantum Chemistry and Physics
Benefits
We offer a competitive salary, private medical insurance, health cash plan, life assurance, equity options, and relocation costs.
We review CVs as we receive them, and interview as soon as we have applications that looks like a good match (usually within one week). We do not use closing dates. So, please apply as soon as possible to avoid missing out on this role. We advertised this role on 22nd July 2022.
If you have any queries, please contact jobs@riverlane.com.
Everyone is welcome at Riverlane. We are an equal opportunities employer and encourage applications from eligible and suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender reassignment, religion or belief, sexual orientation, marital or civil partnership status, or pregnancy and maternity/paternity.

description:
2+ years of experience in a mission critical environment
Job summary
The Amazon Web Services (AWS) Center for Quantum Computing in Pasadena, CA, is seeking a motivated and experienced Facilities Technician who will maintain mission-critical lab facilities for a growing research and development effort. By owning the optimization and maintenance of lab facilities infrastructure, you will help enable a team of scientists and engineers to develop future quantum technologies. Operations knowledge of cleanrooms or engineering/physics laboratories is a plus, but not required. You will work with multiple teams to make sure operational processes and requests meet the needs of the business. Successful candidates have meticulous attention to detail, excellent troubleshooting skills, and adaptability to changing requirements.

Our lab facilities infrastructure includes high-voltage power systems, power distribution, process cooling water loops, mechanical systems, compressed and cryogenic gases, etc. You will coordinate with multiple stakeholders including leadership, contractors, consultants, and engineers to ensure that our facilities meet the needs of the quantum computing program. Your ability to work independently with limited direction, communicate effectively with team members across geographic locations, and provide technical direction will be key to your success.

Key job responsibilities
Maintain and execute a maintenance program for all facilities equipment
Troubleshoot and perform root cause analysis of facilities equipment failures
On-site management of contractors, sub-contractors and vendors, ensuring that all work performed is in accordance with established practices, procedures & local legislation.
Collaborate, plan, and coordinate with internal teams and external stakeholders to execute projects and changes
On-call duties after normal working hours, rotating on a weekly basis.
Role supports multiple locations within the Los Angeles region.

A day in the life
In this role, you will monitor the facilities to ensure equipment is running optimally. You will investigate and troubleshoot any equipment abnormalities to return the equipment to normal operating parameters. You will develop operating and preventive maintenance procedures for installed equipment and either perform or manage contractors executing your procedures. You will track all facilities assets in a local CMMS database, develop critical spare parts lists to maintain equipment high availability, and work with vendors and internal teams to procure parts.

About the team
You will be joining the Infrastructure and Production team within the Quantum Computing organization. Our mission is to protect and serve quantum computers for our customers in the lab and on the cloud. Our vision is to set the gold standard for infrastructure, security, and operations in the quantum cloud computing industry.

Bachelor’s degree in Physical Sciences, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or relevant discipline
Knowledge of and experience with building management systems (such as Tridium Niagara Framework)
Experience working in physics or engineering laboratories, which contain low noise electronics, lasers, EMI/radiation shielded rooms, vacuum systems, cryogenics, etc.
Experience working in semiconductor clean rooms, which contain fan filter systems, plumbing and air handling of hazardous chemicals/gases, vacuum systems, etc.
Experience working in data center facilities, which contain generators, chillers, cooling towers, air handling units, UPS, electrical sub distribution systems, fire detection and suppression systems, cable reticulation systems
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
Strong analytical skills with demonstrated problem solving ability
Eager to learn and enjoy a fast-paced environment
Completion of a technical college program or military occupational training in either electrical, HVAC or industrial automation.
Regularly walk, use hands and fingers, handle or feel, reach with hands and arms, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl, climb stairs, twist, bend, work above shoulders, grasp, carry, push and pull.
Regularly lift and/or move up to 39 pounds independently and participate in group lifts for 40+ pounds

title:
Network Development Engineer, AWS Center for Quantum Computing
Job ID: 2244178 | Amazon Web Services, Inc.
description:
DESCRIPTION
Job summary
The Amazon Web Services (AWS) Center for Quantum Computing (CQC) in Pasadena, CA, is looking to hire a Network Development Engineer (NDE) to create network solutions for an emerging computing technologies. The mission of this role is to enable researchers developing quantum technologies and to bring cloud quantum computing services to AWS’s worldwide customer base. We are seeking a motivated candidate who can who can design new network architectures, configure physical network hardware, and secure networking technology stack. As an NDE in our organization you are expected to communicate across multiple stakeholders including scientists, engineers, organizational partners, external vendors, and leadership. An NDE is also expected to troubleshoot on-premise and remote infrastructure, automate the monitoring of prototype and production systems, and serve in a customer facing support role for our internal service team. On this team you will wear many hats, work smart, and iterate quickly. Successful applicants will have strong written and verbal communication skills, a track record of successfully delivering complex network projects with ambitious timelines, and experience working with local and cross-region environments.

Key job responsibilities
Deploy, automate, and scale network infrastructure across new and existing mission critical environments
Develop proposals and influence without authority to align business and technical stakeholders on approach
Identify and troubleshoot recurring networking, routing, and platform issues towards resolution while engaging with mid and senior-level engineering teams
Create and review documentation and processes for new builds, standard operating procedures, strategic planning, etc.
Identify and deliver on opportunities to automate repeatable networking tasks by creating and maintaining scripts or tools

A day in the life
As a Network Development Engineer at Amazon, your core job responsibility is to design network topologies, architectures, and services that solve for many requirements. The primary area of responsibility you will have is to design ahead of customer or technology needs, always predicting and solving for problems that have not yet occurred. This takes the form of creating and defending high level design documents, working with vendors or internal stakeholders to influence technology roadmaps, constructing and testing your solutions, and providing support to deploy and operate these designs.

About the team
You will be joining the Infrastructure and Production team within the Quantum Computing organization. Our mission is to protect and serve quantum computers for our customers in the lab and on the cloud. Our vision is to set the gold standard for infrastructure, security, and operations in the quantum cloud computing industry.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
5+ years with internet routing protocols and concepts: TCP/IP, BGP, MPLS, ISIS and/or OSPF
3+ years professional experience working in large scale networking environments
3+ years with network operating systems such as Cisco IOS and Junos.
3+ years working in a Linux/Unix environment
3+ in automation via Bash/shell scripting and Perl/Python programming
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience working with customers to diagnose a problem and work toward a resolution
Experience with agile development methodologies and DevOps environments
Strong desire to build, ability to multitask, sense of ownership and urgency
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Expert-level certifications (e.g. CCIE, JNCIE) is a big plus

For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.
