Job summary
Amazon Braket the quantum computing service in Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for a senior Product Manager.

As a product leader on the Amazon Braket team, you will be responsible for driving customer engagement and adoption of the Braket service. You will define and drive specific motions aimed at growing our presence in the academic, and open-source community, as well as own customer engagement on our public facing websites, blogs and customer content.

Key job responsibilities
Define and execute the strategy for growing Braket's customer engagement and adoption, particularly among academics, univerisities and open-source developers.
Partner with product, engineering, design, marketing, and business stakeholders to build and ship innovative content, as well as influence the product roadmap to drive adoption.
Drive and own roadmap strategy and definition, including understanding the needs of our end AWS customers, aligning product goals to business objectives, and driving feature delivery and trade-offs.
Collaborate effectively with and cross-functional partners and stakeholders including PMs, marketers, engineers, scientists, and UX professionals.
Strong leadership qualities, great judgment, clear communication, and a track record of delivering great products will be important to ensuring success in role.

About the team
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Masters Degree in a technical field such as mathematics, physics, engineering or computer science
Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
Experience overseeing roadmap strategy and definition
10+ years of product experience, preferably with large scale enterprise / service-based business experience
Experience with quantitative cross-channel marketing, and content management
Experience as Product Owner within Agile/SCRUM enterprise-scale software development environments
Understanding of fundamentals of quantum computing
Relevant experience working within the quantum industry or delivering highly technical products
History of developing business strategy in conjunction with senior leadership
Excellent written and oral communications skills, including experience communicating to executives.
Experience communicating with external stakeholders and customers

description:
Introduction
IBM’s Industry Consultants are essential to our clients as they work to reinvent themselves for the future. Join our highly visible and highly skilled team of global consultants as we strive to accelerate sales, deliver client engagements, and build IBM’s market eminence. If you are a forward-thinker and a curious intellectual, we welcome you to apply for your next exciting career challenge!

Your Role and Responsibilities
IBM Quantum Industry Consultant
Automobile and Aerospace & Defense, Discrete Manufacturing Industry

Quantum computers are incredibly powerful machines that take a new approach to processing information. Built on the principles of quantum mechanics, they exploit complex and fascinating laws of nature that are always there, but usually remain hidden from view. By harnessing such natural behavior, quantum computers can run new types of algorithms to process information more holistically. They may one day lead to revolutionary breakthroughs in materials and drug discovery, the optimization of complex manmade systems, and artificial intelligence. We expect them to open doors that we once thought would remain locked indefinitely.

IBM Services is looking for a Quantum Industry Consultant who will provide automobile and aerospace & defense manufacturing industry-specific thought leadership and advisory services as part of our Quantum Network team of experts. You will collaborate across a network of IBM experts and with external parties to drive quantum computing awareness, adoption and identification of exploratory use cases in support of C-suite initiatives with strategic clients.

Create C-suite advisory artifacts and thought leadership for automobile and aerospace & defense, and discrete manufacturing industry

Strong automobile and aerospace & defense manufacturing industry expertise

title: Quantum Machine Learning Scientist
description:
Quantinuum is looking for an Applied Scientist to expand its Machine Learning and Quantum Algorithms division.

As a member of a dedicated team of scientists, you will participate in and shape our research programme by designing algorithms that combine machine learning methods, statistical techniques and quantum computing for novel applications; you will implement and benchmark your algorithms on the best quantum computing hardware available, in-house and from our partners. You will share your ideas with the wider research community by publishing significant results in peer-reviewed journals and by presenting them at international conferences. Your enthusiasm for learning about new application domains will be essential for the success of our external R&D collaborations with industry partners. With guidance from fellow team members, you will be expected to develop the skills necessary for supporting external collaborations via scientific scoping, problem formulation, and implementation of prototype solutions using quantum algorithms.

Quantum Machine Learning at Quantinuum
The goal of the Machine Learning and Quantum Algorithms team at Quantinuum is to make the most of today’s quantum computers with innovative quantum algorithms and a view toward early applications across industries. Our research often combines concepts from classical machine learning and advanced statistics, such as generative models, energy-based models and probabilistic inference, with quantum computing concepts such as quantum signal processing and parameterised quantum circuits. This role is compatible with multiple research backgrounds: either you are a classical ML or statistics researcher and wish to develop into a quantum computing role, or you come from a quantum computing background and are interested in applying your expertise to machine learning and related computational problems. The team is committed to supporting your development in either case.
Responsibilities
Conduct research at the interface of machine learning and quantum computing
Collaborate with scientists in a dynamic team and contribute to ongoing research projects in quantum machine learning
Communicate progress of research collaborations and publicise results in the wider research community
Assist scientific project managers in scientific scoping of external R&D collaborations
Develop prototype code and support technical deliverables of external R&D collaborations
Key requirements
Familiarity with either research-level ML and desire to combine this with quantum computing or familiarity with current research in quantum algorithms and desire to work on machine learning techniques
PhD in quantum physics, mathematics, computer science, or related field (Master’s with a strong research record will also be considered)
Ability to work independently with internal and external teams from diverse research backgrounds
Enthusiasm for applying research to industrially relevant problems in creative but hands-on ways
Desirable skills
Proven ability to publish research in quantum computing or machine learning in peer-reviewed journals or high-impact conferences
Ability to implement quantum or ML algorithms in a high-level language (e.g. Python) and with relevant tools, such as JAX, PyTorch, SciPy, tket, Qiskit etc.
Familiarity with current quantum computer capabilities and their implementation aspects
Ability to clearly communicate scientific results to a technical audience
What is in it for you?
Working alongside a highly talented team, with leading names in the quantum computing industry. We offer a highly competitive package, equity, 28 days of paid holiday (in addition to public holidays), a workplace pension, a positive approach to flexible working and enhanced parental and adoption benefits.

About Us:

Science Led and Enterprise Driven. 

Our team of scientists is leading the way in the development of quantum computing. The world’s largest integrated quantum computing company, we united Cambridge Quantum’s advanced software development with Honeywell Quantum Solutions’ high-fidelity hardware to accelerate quantum computing. With full-stack technology, we’re scaling quantum computing and developing applications to solve the world’s most pressing challenges. We could be even better with you!

At Quantinuum, we believe quantum information systems will revolutionize the way we work and live. We are leading the way by helping our customers develop quantum-enabled solutions that provide a competitive-edge in their markets. 

We’re hiring the world’s best talent to make it happen. Join us! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ErQOKNC2O38  

Please note that employment with us is subject to successfully passing our pre-employment screening checks. We are an inclusive equal opportunity employer. You will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.
APPLY FOR THIS JOB

title: Senior Quantum Engineer
description: Rigetti Computing is building the world’s most powerful computers to solve humanity’s most pressing problems. We believe this technology will fundamentally change the world for the better and will affect nearly every industry over the coming decades. Now a public company, Rigetti is looking to expand its Quantum Engineering team through the addition of an experienced Senior Quantum Engineer.

Support, as a technical consultant, the development and management of innovative government-run research and technology programs centered on the computational analysis of complex physical systems. Provide strategic assessments of new technologies in support of senior decision-makers while conducting background research in evaluating the feasibility and the defense applications of new technological concepts. Produce and present findings and recommendations to a team of colleagues and clients, assist with program ideation and technical program management, and brief materials out for government R&D efforts. Work with world-class scientists in driving forward groundbreaking research efforts developing new understandings and applications of computational analysis of complex systems such as quantum turbulence and nanophotonics. position: Business Development Executive for IBM Quantum
title: Business Development Executive for IBM Quantum
description:

title: Principal Engineer
description:
Principal Engineer
Qrypt is an early-stage technology startup building the next generation of cryptography to protect from the threat of quantum computers and those machines and mathematics yet to be invented. Our passion is to help organizations and people keep their data private – forever. We securely build, design, and deploy safe systems that ensure people’s privacy. Together, we will transform the way the world safeguards data and communications!
The Qrypt Principal Engineer will provide technical leadership to deliver advanced cryptographic solutions based on distributed entropy, impervious to even quantum-based attacks. They will guide the Qrypt software engineering team to build, deploy and operate these services on behalf of our customers.
Preferred location is New York City but will consider alternate remote locations.
Our Tech Stack
We build and deploy our software in Azure
We implement a proprietary tier of hardware
We build a client in C++ and supporting services in Python
We use Kafka for pub-sub, Redis for in-memory storage
We use Docker and Kubernetes for containerization and orchestration
Responsibilities
Be the technical leader for the Qrypt software development team composed of software engineers, mathematicians, physicists and cryptographers
Work collaboratively with the Qrypt Cloud Architect to ensure we deliver cryptographic services to our worldwide customers which meets customer SLAs for: Security, Scalability, Availability, Reliability and Usability
Cascade the high-level architecture to component teams to ensure every component meets our requirements
Mentor software engineers to share your experience designing/building applications and leading others
Work closely with the systems team on integration of our third-party and proprietary hardware components with our Cloud infrastructure and the enabling libraries, APIs, measurement, monitoring, and evaluation systems to help ensure an end-to-end system that is reliable, high-performance, and verifiable.
Qualification
12+ years of design and coding experience of highly-scalable distributed systems using C/C++ and Python
5+ years delivering major public cloud services, preferably Azure, to a global customer base
Demonstrated expertise in designing microservices environments
Demonstrated expertise in modern security design patterns
Demonstrated expertise in Linux, Ubuntu and macOS
Experience integrating open-source software, Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes, real-time monitoring, ML-driven data analytics, etc.
Attitude
You are passionate working in an environment designed to deliver post-quantum security and privacy.
You are a technical leader of engineers. You demonstrate comprehensive responsibility from requirements generation through, design, build and operation of Qrypt cloud services.
You value effective communication and collaboration as the way to make better products.
You're interested in working with leading technologies in the quantum information sciences: quantum random number generation, post-quantum cryptography, secure messaging, and privacy preservation techniques.
Benefits & Perks
Competitive Pay & Equity
Paid Time Off
Medical, dental & vision plan participation
Strong 401K matching program
Gym Reimbursement
But above all, be part of an amazing team! Together, we’ll make this world a safer place
The annual base pay range for this role is between $250,000 and $350,000. The actual base salary pay offered may vary based on multiple factors such as qualifications, experience, transferable skills, level of education, and other factors permitted by law. Please note that this salary information is solely for candidates hired to perform work in this location and refers to the amount Qrypt is willing to pay at the time of this posting. The range listed is just one component of Qrypt's total compensation package.
Tk3uwhG8xi
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $250,000.00 - $350,000.00 per year

title:
Key Account Manager - QT
UK - Cambridge
description:
Toshiba Europe Limited has pioneered the development of quantum communication systems over the past decade, setting new standards for quantum cryptography and data security. We have  recently launched a new business division in the UK to commercialise our world leading QKD technology
Due to continued growth we seek a Key Account Manager for our Quantum Technology business division.  He or she will be responsible for developing business opportunities with targeted customers and key partners in the EMEA region, supported by the technical and management teams in Cambridge, UK.  This is an  opportunity to drive market growth in dynamic and exciting new business, supported by one of the best known companies in digital electronics and services. 
Key responsibilities:
Identify and engage with target accounts to understand their objectives and business drivers for quantum cryptography and to communicate the Toshiba value proposition accordingly
Create and own the account plan and sales strategy for target accounts, work closely with local and virtual Toshiba technical and supporting teams to deliver strategic deployments, business partnerships and sales
Identify and engage with potential Toshiba business partners to develop partnerships, business plans, agreements and sales
Work with Toshiba global technical marketing and marcom teams to develop market awareness, formulate our market positioning and develop key messages for partners/customers
Track status and progress of projects with customers and partners. Sustain key customer relationships and be the advocate of the customer within Toshiba
Reporting directly to the head of the business division based in the UK and liaising with the business development teams in Japan and US.
Mandatory requirements:
Proven track record in business development and sales of high value, complex sales cycle infrastructure deployments into tier 1 operators
Extensive knowledge of fibre optic communication, operator networks and/or IT security systems. 
Degree level qualification in Engineering or Business-related subject.
Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to qualify an opportunity along with the customers business objectives
Strong organisational skills with attention to detail.
Ability to work with many teams and individuals across the organisation.

Preferable:
Experience of business development in the telecom or IT security sectors.
Previous formal sales training (e.g. Target Account Selling, MEDDIC)

Quantum Specialist - Quantum chemist

Do you have a passion for innovation and emerging technologies along with a firm foundation in the core principles of technology? Would you like to be a part of the early-stage development of a new firm offering? We are currently seeking a computation biologist who will be part of our quantum computing consulting offering.

Given the potential for quantum technology to drastically improve computational abilities in chemistry and biology, you will help Deloitte stay on the cutting of edge of what is possible for our clients. You will be responsible for driving technical exploration, research, and development of quantum use cases that relate to computational biology. Additionally, you will lead conversations with researchers, clients, and our partners in the quantum ecosystem (e.g., hardware/software vendors, start-ups).

Work you'll do
Design and develop algorithms, proof of concepts, prototypes and solutions to bring to market
Conduct technical research focused on understanding the "art of the possible" for our clients with regards to Quantum Computing and other quantum technologies (communication, sensing, etc.)
Design a roadmap for our clients' future use of Quantum Computing and related technologies
Work with cross-industry leaders to identify business opportunities enabled by Quantum technologies
Engage with our Quantum Computing ecosystem
Support the development and delivery of Quantum Labs to help our clients understand how to think about - and leverage - quantum technologies and prepare for the future
Drive the development and application of digital twins to Human Phenome verticals as the scientific lead
Support LSHC projects, including Health Care Big Data, Model-Based Delivery System Design, and Health Care Science of Science
Work with global leadership and institute teams to develop quantum eminence and solutions that can be commercialized on a global scale

Qualifications

Required:
5+ years of relevant experience including hands-on experience running simulations on Quantum and high-performance computing (GPU) environments for corporate R&D, innovation labs, or academic research.
Degree in computational physics, computational chemistry or materials science, or related discipline.
Experience with material or chemical simulation using quantum or classical algorithms.
Knowledge of applying or developing quantum algorithms on quantum hardware for molecular simulation.
Experience with advanced ML/AI techniques in materials or drug discovery.
Proficient in a scientific programming environment (i.e. one or more of Julia, Python, Mathematica, MATLAB)
Experience developing and giving presentations to senior executives both technical and non-technical
Experience leading discussions with and advising senior executives in the pragmatic art of the possible based on real world experience
Publish peer-reviewed journals related to quantum chemistry, material simulation or drug discovery

Preferred:
Ability to grow new business relationships with senior (e.g., C-suite) stakeholders
Experience building strategic roadmaps and developing business cases
Experience with new product development and hybrid business models and corresponding go-to-market activation
Relevant industry experience in pharmaceutical industry, drug discovery or quantum startups

Professional Skills
Strong sense of intellectual curiosity
Self-starter, organized, focused with an entrepreneur mindset
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Willingness to learn continuously and mentor to share knowledge
Experience in community building

Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.

The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for any applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $109,000 to $199,000.

You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

title: Senior PCB/Flex Process Engineer - Assembly and Manufacturing
description:
Rigetti Computing is developing cloud-deployed quantum computers to solve humanity’s most pressing and valuable problems. We are a highly diverse and interdisciplinary team of scientists and engineers working at the cutting edge of technology in a mission-driven entrepreneurial environment. We believe that bringing together teams from various cultures, educational backgrounds, and technical disciplines helps them to see things from more points of view and to make great products that change the world for the better.
As a PCB/Flex Process Engineer - Assembly and Manufacturing on the Hardware team at Rigetti Computing, you will develop cutting-edge solutions to enable the scaling of quantum computers in complexity to a larger number of qubits while increasing performance, focusing on developing high-density signal delivery leveraging flex and rigid PCBs, and assembly solutions that enable microwave RF signaling to our quantum devices at cryogenic temperatures. You will be working closely with a team of electrical engineers, mechanical engineers, and physicists, as well as outside component suppliers, to define component & assembly processes that meet these scaling & performance challenges. You will guide supplier process development and integrate components, design test protocols and integrate those components into the R&D and production release workflows.
The ideal candidate brings experience working with suppliers on the materials & processes used in PCBs, Flexible Electronics, and Assembly of components, preferably using innovative materials. You enjoy working in a multi-disciplinary environment, and you excel at translating functional requirements into prototypes and then guiding those products through development into low-volume manufacturing. You are able to identify requirements and constraints and manage effective test programs that navigate these inputs. You are a strong communicator who keeps stakeholders informed and involved.
About You
BS degree or higher in Mechanical Engineering, Materials Science, Electrical Engineering, Physics, or related field
3+ years of relevant industry experience
Experience working with (or at) suppliers to specify and develop PCB, Flex, and/or assembly processes
Experience with the full development cycle of components - from concept to prototype to production- and with defining the requirements at each stage, including knowledge of quality control and manufacturing processes
Experience with process flows, integration challenges, and material choices for at least one of PCBs, Flex, and Assembly processes
Experience with plating processes - specifying & characterizing results
Familiarity with IPC A-610 and IPC 6013, or equivalent for quality and acceptance criteria of PCB and flex circuitry
Hands-on experience with Design for Manufacturing and identifying and solving defect issues & process control issues in PCB/Flex/Assembly, and being able to communicate feedback to the supplier for corrective action and yield improvement
You are excited by and value learning and growth
Excellent technical communication and collaboration skills in a multi-domain environment including mechanical engineers and physicists
Preferred Qualifications
Understanding of superconducting and cryogenic behavior of materials and their use in electronic components
Familiarity with PCB layout software
Why You Should Join
Opportunity to think creatively, uncover, tailor, and advance the state of the art in quantum computing research toward quantum advantage
Connect to world-class researchers and engineers
Opportunity to develop and own tools that will meaningfully shape engineering and business processes here at Rigetti
Benefits and Perks:
Rigetti seeks individuals who are motivated by grand challenges and the opportunity to make a meaningful impact in the exciting quantum computing space. As long-term visionaries, we offer employees opportunities for continuous personal and professional growth so they can advance our mission to help solve humanity's most important and pressing problems. To support the financial success and health of our employees and their families, we offer the following benefits in addition to a competitive base salary:
*
401k Plan
Generous Equity Grant
98% coverage on Medical (Kaiser or Anthem Blue Cross), Guardian Dental, Guardian Vision
Anthem Blue Cross Life Insurance at no cost to the employee
Opportunities for additional performance-based equity grants or bonuses
To help our employees bring their best selves to work, we also offer various perks to support each individual to perform at their highest level and foster work life balance. All full-time exempt employees are eligible for:
- Flexible PTO as soon as they join.
Fitness Activity & Gym Membership Reimbursement
16 Week Paid Parental Leave
FSA & Commuter Benefits
Employment Assistance Program (EAP)
Flexible Work Schedule
As we continue to grow our company, we will prioritize applicants who have created a thoughtful application and share our vision and passion for quantum computing. While we regret that we can't hire every applicant, we keep applications on file for 2 years and will reach out if you're a good fit for a future opportunity.
About Rigetti
Rigetti Computing is a pioneer in full-stack quantum computing. The company has operated quantum computers over the cloud since 2017 and serves global enterprise, government, and research clients through its Rigetti Quantum Cloud Services platform. The company’s proprietary quantum-classical infrastructure provides ultra-low latency integration with public and private clouds for high-performance practical quantum computing. Rigetti has developed the industry’s first multi-chip quantum processor for scalable quantum computing systems. The company designs and manufactures its chips in-house at Fab-1, the industry’s first dedicated and integrated quantum device manufacturing facility. Rigetti was founded in 2013 by Chad Rigetti and today employs more than 180 people with offices in the United States, U.K., and Australia. Learn more at www.rigetti.com.
Don't see the job you want? Apply here so we can keep in touch with you when the right role opens up in the future!
*
Export Licensing Compliance*
This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws and regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) and/or the Export Administration Regulations (EAR). Please note that any offer for employment may be conditioned on authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export control laws and regulations without sponsorship for an export license. In order to ensure compliance, Rigetti must determine U.S. citizenship or U.S. visa/immigration status of all prospective applicants for this position.
Any citizenship information provided will be reviewed solely for export control compliance purposes. Only applicants eligible to receive export-controlled items, software, technology, and information will be considered for this position. Citizenship information will be handled in accordance with Rigetti’s policies prohibiting discrimination based upon classifications protected by federal, state, or local law.
Rigetti is committed to full compliance with applicable anti-discrimination laws. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We strive to create an inclusive work environment and will not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Quantinuum - Lead Engineering Technician
description:
Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity
Science Led and Enterprise Driven.
Our team of scientists is leading the way in the development of quantum computing. The world’s largest integrated quantum computing company, we united Cambridge Quantum’s advanced software development with Honeywell Quantum Solutions’ high-fidelity hardware to accelerate quantum computing. With full-stack technology, we’re scaling quantum computing and developing applications to solve the world’s most pressing challenges. We could be even better with you!
At Quantinuum, we believe quantum information systems will revolutionize the way we work and live. We are leading the way by helping our customers develop quantum-enabled solutions that provide a competitive-edge in their markets.
We’re hiring the world’s best talent to make it happen. Join us! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ErQOKNC2O38

We are seeking a Lead Engineering Technician in our Golden Valley, MN or Brooklyn Park MN Locations. This role reports directly to the Sr. ISC Operations Manager. Flexible work schedule

title: Lead in Quantum Modeling
description:
The Lead the Quantum Modeling team, is dedicated to providing theoretical and numerical support to R&D.
In particular, he/she will be in charge of:
managing the team and recruiting new members (if needed)
providing theoretical and numerical support for the design of efficient realistic quantum protocols on hardware
analyzing and modeling experimental data
interacting with the Quantum Algorithm team for the co-design of new algorithms and implementations of client projects on hardware
interacting with the Emulation team to guide the development of numerical tools for efficient numerical simulations of the hardware
Requirements
Advanced skills in quantum information and atomic physics
Knowledge in numerical simulations
Strong interest in hardware and cold atom; an experimental background is a plus
Fluent in English
Keen interest in deep tech and new technologies
Good interpersonal skills and ability to work within a team.
With 3 years of experience in a similar position

title: R&D Hardware Quantum Engineer (mid-Sr)
description:
Within the Research & Development team, you will be involved in the development of neutral atoms quantum processors. As a quantum hardware engineer, you will contribute to the assembly, tuning and operation of a processor and to the specification and achievement of its overall performance.
You will also be involved in the design and implementation of new technological developments, which you will be responsible for testing and validating on the processor. For this purpose, you will need to collaborate across the hardware and software teams of PASQAL.
You will finally assist in the practical implementation on the processor of quantum simulations and of quantum computing algorithms.
This position is a job creation, to foster the growth of PASQAL’s activity.
Requirements
You hold a MSc or a PhD in Quantum Physics.
A previous research experience is preferred in Atomic and Molecular Optics; an experience in cold neutral atoms or ions will be highly valued.
The successful candidate will have a strong taste for Quantum Information and Atomic Physics, and a keen interest in deep tech and new technologies. We are looking for someone who is really excited about our technologies and the scientific challenge that we are facing.
Your main scientific and technical skills are in optics, hardware / software interfacing and data analysis.
In this position you will build upon your interpersonal skills and ability to work within a team.
English fluency is required for this position.

title: Quantum Software Engineer
description:
The Quantum Libraries team is in charge of designing, developing and maintaining the software tools and modules that bridge the gap between the quantum hardware (QPUs: Quantum Processing Units) and the users and application developers.
These tools and modules encompass:
frontend interfaces to design quantum programs to be run on emulators or the QPU, at both the gate and pulse levels (e.g. Pulser),
quantum circuit compilers, comprising optimization, transpilation and assembly into hardware instructions,
tools and SDKs that accelerate and simplify the development of high-level quantum applications.
Within the Team you will especially be in charge of:
overseeing the maintenance of existing modules and projects,
developing an in-depth understanding of the activities and tasks in the projects in your perimeter,
contributing to the design and implementation of new features,
collaborating closely with the teams at PASQAL to specify and develop the tools that address their needs in the best possible manner,
playing an active role in the invention and proposal of novel algorithms, methods or techniques, whether technical or scientific.
This position is a job creation, to foster the growth of PASQAL’s activity.
Requirements
You hold a MSc or an Engineering degree with a major in Physics, Computer Science or in a related field.
Your professional background has provided you with at least 4 years of experience in software development in a comparable position and/or through demonstrable contributions to open-source software projects.
The successful candidate will have proven proficiency and experience with Python, and a strong experience in source control (Git) and Continuous Integration tools.
You have a taste for collaborative coding practices, especially for code reviews. During your professional career, you have acquired the continuous practice of a well-structured, tested and documented code.
In this position you will build upon your interpersonal skills and ability to work within a team, while being able to work independently with limited directions and to make well-thought decisions throughout the development process.
English professional proficiency is mandatory to work in PASQAL’s international environment.

4+ years working in engineering/scientific laboratory, or data center environment
Job summary
Interested in being part of a team that’s pushing the bounds of what’s possible with quantum technology?

We are looking for a lab engineer to help build up new quantum laboratory infrastructure. You will work closely with our existing quantum science and engineering team to define requirements and design, build, and maintain key components of a state-of-the-art quantum laboratory environment. You will also work cross-functionally with others in the science and engineering team to support and enable their work measuring novel quantum devices.

Potential responsibilities may include:
Building up new laboratory infrastructure
Design, construction, and maintenance of laboratory mechanical, electrical, and/or plumbing systems
Working collaboratively with research scientists and engineers
Work/Life Balance
We understand that developing quantum technology is a marathon, not a sprint. Mental and physical wellness is encouraged within our team and throughout AWS. The work/life integration within Amazon encourages a culture where employees work hard and have ownership over their downtime. We are exploring more structured wellness elements including meditation scheduling, running group meet-ups, and a culture of sharing wellness tips.

Mentorship and Career Growth
We are committed to the growth and development of every member of our team. You will receive career-growth-minded management and mentorship from a software and science team and also have the opportunity to participate in Amazon's mentorship programs. You will work closely with quantum research scientists and have opportunities to learn about quantum technology and contribute to the development of scientific software for quantum information systems at AWS.

Inclusive and Diverse Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

6+ years working in engineering/scientific/data center environments
Bachelors in science or engineering
Working knowledge of digital and/or analog electronics
Experience integrating complex laboratory equipment with building infrastructure
Automation and scripting using Python
Experience maintaining cryogenic and/or vacuum systems
Strong operational and organizational skills
Experience with mechanical, electrical, and/or plumbing systems in research or engineering facilities
Experience in one or more of the following areas: analog/digital electronics, CAD modeling/mechanical system design
Basic scripting experience

2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience
Programming experience with at least one software programming language.

A degree involving programming (e.g. Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics) or equivalent technical experience

title: Software Engineer (Back-end)
description:
About us
We hold the key to making quantum useful! Q-CTRL is a company with a deep start-up spirit with offices in Sydney, Los Angeles and Berlin. Our goal is to revolutionise the way quantum technology is used by delivering transformational, real-life outcomes for the world’s most innovative and impactful industry. Simply put, we make quantum technology useful.

We’re led by our values; to be real, be trusted, be just and to be revered. They guide us in everything we do, how we work together and how we shape the future of the quantum field. To help us do that, we’ve brought together an inspiring team of world leading physicists, engineers, product and design specialists (to name a few!). So whether you’re a quantum expert or simply unsure where you fit into a business like ours, we want to hear from you!

About the team
The back-end engineering team works closely with our Quantum Control Engineering, Front-end Engineering, DevOps Engineering, Product, Marketing and Design teams. Collaboration is extremely important to us and these multiple touch points help us advocate a culture and practice of quality and continuous improvement throughout the business. This is a great opportunity to make a real impact whilst contributing to backend engineering best practices, delivery software that is elegant, efficient, secure, tested and documented.
What you'll be doing:
Develop, test and document Q-CTRL’s APIs, associated Microservices and client packages as part of delivering product features
Work closely across all teams to fully understand requirements for new product features, in particular as defined by the Product team and expressed as scenarios using Gherkin Syntax (Given, When, Then)
Review and address code and comments submitted by the team via pull requests
Stay up-to-date with current best-practices in your field with a willingness to share knowledge freely
Ideally you'll have:
Experience with Python Web Frameworks (Django, Flask, FastAPI), Microservices, RESTful Web Services or GraphQL is preferable however, others will also be considered
Alternatively, you may have experience in Ruby on Rails, Node.js, etc
Our core values resonate with you (to be real, trusted, just and revered) and you have a willingness to adapt, collaborate and help others
We’re a successful start-up company which means we move quickly, but with thought and empathy. Understanding how to operate within these parameters is extremely important
Start-up environment experience would be preferable but not a necessity
Ideally you will have a Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent practical experience
Why Q-CTRL?

Flexibility: We embrace hybrid and remote work so you can focus more on your global impact rather than rigid work schedules
Parental support: Family comes first. We offer paid parental leave to support you and your family
Diversity: As an equal employment opportunity employer, we value diversity, inclusion and providing equal opportunities to all. We do this by actively supporting community initiatives around the world promoting diversity and including in STEM among others
Competitive remuneration: Enjoy the start-up life without start-up wages
Equity: We offer the potential for equity share and annual bonuses so you have a sense of ownership in what you do
Well funded: We closed our Series B in November 2021
Unique culture: You’ll be surrounded by leading physicists, engineers, product, marketing and design teams globally with a strong desire to learn and transfer knowledge
Our values: You’ll work alongside our incredibly supportive team that works consistently to deliver our core values to be real, be trusted, be just and to be revered
Personal development: We provide you with a generous personal development and wellness budget
Meaningful work: Last but not least, you’ll have the opportunity to work in one of the world’s leading deep technology companies and truly make an impact that matters!

Please note: Q-CTRL is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that values the strength diversity brings to the workplace. We are committed to being inclusive in the way we hire. We strongly encourage you to apply even if you do not meet all of the requirements mentioned in the job posting.

To recruitment agencies, we do not accept unsolicited branded profiles and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

description:

 We are looking for an Executive Assistant. As an Executive Assistant, you’ll be part of a cross-functional team whose mission is to lead IonQ on its journey to build the world’s best quantum computers to solve the world’s most complex problems.

position: Principal / Sr. Principal Analog/Mixed Signal Integrated Circuit (IC) Design Engineer
location: Location: Linthicum, Maryland, United States of America
title: Principal / Sr. Principal Analog/Mixed Signal Integrated Circuit (IC) Design Engineer
description:
At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

Are you interested in shifting into the cutting edge of IC circuit design? Your experience is needed, you'll leverage your current experience against our training and your team's experience and then you'll be designing RQL and superconducting devices in a highly collaborative environment in no time.
Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) Advanced Capabilities division is leading the development of the next generation of high-performance computing. Superconducting electronics forms the core of our technology, with development thrusts in both quantum and classical logic. Our quantum computing activities include the development of superconducting devices for both quantum annealing and gate-model quantum computation. Our classical computing activities focus on energy-efficient computation using our patented superconducting digital logic technology, Reciprocal Quantum Logic (RQL). You’ll work in a fast-paced team environment alongside a broad array of scientists and engineers to make these processing solutions a reality.
We are seeking Analog/Mixed Signal IC Design Engineers to join our team in design and layout of full-custom digital and mixed signal superconducting circuits. You will use your skills as an Integrated Circuit designer while learning about superconducting circuit design. Tasks will include schematic capture, circuit simulation, circuit layout, physical verification (Layout vs. Schematic and Design Rule Checking), and parasitic extraction for a variety of superconducting circuits. The right candidate will be comfortable in a dynamic environment with rapidly developing technologies and tools. The candidate must have some experience in custom circuit design, preferably with Cadence Virtuoso. Experience with modeling circuit performance in Spice or Spectre, and/or experience with physical RF modeling in HFSS or COMSOL is highly desirable. Familiarity with quantum information is a plus. The candidate must be able to create a functional verification and test plan based on requirements of the circuit. The candidate should be able to take a design from concept through physical verification. Strong written and oral communication skills are required.
This position requires on-site work at our Advanced Technology Lab (ATL) in Linthicum, Maryland.
This position can be filled at the Principal Analog/Mixed Signal Design Engineer level OR the Sr. Principal Analog/Mixed Signal Design Engineer. Qualifications for both are listed below:
Basic Qualifications for Principal Analog/Mixed Signal Design Engineer:
Bachelor's degree in a technical area with 5 years of experience in Analog/Mixed Signal Circuit design (3 years with technical MS or 0 years with a PhD) - Experience with full product life cycle (requirements, design, implementation, simulation, verification) of mixed signal design.
Working knowledge of mixed signal design flow including design, simulation, layout and physical verification (DRC/LVS).
Experience with some of the following: IC custom design tools (e.g. Cadence or Mentor) for schematic capture, circuit simulation, and full custom layout; mixed-signal circuit design experience (Digital and Analog); physical verification utilizing Cadence Assura or Mentor Calibre.
Ability to obtain and maintain US Security Clearance.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with circuit modeling in HFSS, ADS, or Matlab.
Strong design automation skills.
Electronics test lab experience.
Knowledge of Quantum Information or Quantum Mechanics.
Experience with low-temperature experimental measurements, microwave engineering.
Active TS/SCI Security Clearance.
Basic Qualifications for Sr. Principal Analog/Mixed Signal Design Engineer:
Bachelor's degree in a technical area with 9 years of experience in Analog/Mixed Signal Circuit design (7 years with technical MS or 4 years with a PhD).
Experience with full product life cycle (requirements, design, implementation, simulation, verification) of mixed signal design.
Working knowledge of mixed signal design flow including design, simulation, layout and physical verification (DRC/LVS).
Experience with some of the following: IC custom design tools (e.g. Cadence or Mentor) for schematic capture, circuit simulation, and full custom layout; mixed-signal circuit design experience (Digital and Analog); physical verification utilizing Cadence Assura or Mentor Calibre.
Ability to obtain and maintain US Security Clearance.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with circuit modeling in HFSS, ADS, or Matlab.
Strong design automation skills - Electronics test lab experience.
Knowledge of Quantum Information or Quantum Mechanics.
Experience with low-temperature experimental measurements, microwave engineering.
Active TS/SCI Security Clearance.
"

title: Senior Manager, Software Engineering, Quantum Operating Systems
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ's computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.

We are looking for a Senior Manager, Software Engineering to lead the development of the core of our quantum operating system, in partnership with our principal engineers. Never worked on a quantum operating system? It's much like a robot operating system, managing feedback loops between sensors and actuators at various time scales to precisely tune an environment where we can perform high fidelity quantum computations. In this role, you'll help hire, grow, and coordinate our quantum OS team, helping us continue to build the world's best quantum computers.
The ideal candidate will have experience leading or contributing to multiple simultaneous initiatives, balancing multiple activities with a keen eye for prioritizing for the biggest impact. You'll be able to balance technical expertise and savvy with strong business judgment to make great technology choices with lasting impact. You'll strive for simplicity and demonstrate significant creativity and incisive judgment. You'll enjoy learning technical topics, working across multiple business streams, and be uniquely positioned to help us reach the next horizon in secure quantum computing.
Responsibilities:
Ensure high quality, scalable, well-tested software through architecture and code reviews
Provide technical expertise in building robust and well-engineered software solutions
Own the engineering roadmap for your team
Grow a team of Software Engineers with deep expertise working with hardware and automation
Lead the team through identification and negotiation of product scope and schedule
Effectively self-manage technical roadmaps, multiple projects, priorities, deadlines, and deliverables
Identify, track and mitigate execution roadblocks and technical risks
Assist in the career development of others, including performance assessments for mid-year and end-of-year reviews, and providing mentorship on advanced technical issues
Work with cross-functional teams to make forward-looking engineering choices, between the cloud platform that feeds jobs to our OS and the real-time subsystem that executes programs on behalf of the OS
Provide clear, concise communication to management, product development teams, and customers
Collaborate and communicate with physicists, designers, electrical engineers, external vendors, and other software engineering managers
Drive continuous improvement to an established product development process
In your first three months, you'll be helping hire key staff to scale this function, and defining the technical vision for the next year—and beyond
You'd be a good fit with:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, or related field, or equivalent practical experience
5+ years of hands-on technical leadership and people management experience
10+ years programming experience in Go, Rust, or C++, or similar systems-level programming language
Comfort in resource-constrained, multithreaded execution environments
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proven working experience with highly-structured data
Experience in working with technical experts outside of traditional software engineering, particularly electrical engineers and physicists
Knowledge of team management best practices and demonstrated experience building and scaling effective teams
Empathy and customer focus: you'll work closely with our internal team of physicists who depend on our software every day
You'd be a great fit with:
MS or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statics, Physics, Electrical Engineering or a related degree
10+ years of hands-on technical leadership and people management experience
Experience with embedded systems
A background in robotics, digital signal processing, control theory, machine learning and/or mathematical optimization
Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a 15 minute metro ride from Washington DC. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. However, IonQ will be expanding into additional geographies both domestically and internationally so don't let this stop you from applying.

At IonQ, we believe in fair treatment, access, opportunity and advancement for all, while at the same time striving to identify and eliminate barriers. We empower employees to thrive by fostering a culture of autonomy, productivity, and respect. We are dedicated to creating an environment in which any individual can feel welcomed, respected, supported and valued.

We are committed to equity and justice. We welcome different voices and viewpoints and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, age, sexual orientation, and military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.

If you are interested in being a part of this team and mission, we encourage you to apply.
IonQ Covid-19 Policy: IonQ requires all employees to provide proof of full vaccination for Covid-19 before starting employment.

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
Solutions Engineer
Qrypt builds quantum-secure encryption software and hardware in partnership with world-class national laboratories and academic institutions. We value protecting individual privacy and being transparent about the technology we use to enable it. The foundation of Qrypt technology is published by our experts in peer-reviewed scientific journals and supported by a growing portfolio of international patents. Qrypt’s product portfolio builds on these technologies to ensure enduring data security in the quantum age.
Qrypt is seeking a Solutions Engineer who will be responsible for designing the enablement plans and configuration specifications and perform installation processes to integrate software systems and products for customers. You will establish yourself as the subject matter expert and product-area expert to provide engineering solutions for our customers. We are seeking someone who is passionate about providing the most impactful solution for our clients’ business needs.
Preferred location is New York City and will consider remote.
Responsibilities
Works with product, marketing, business development and sales to ensure we can effectively market, price, sell and service the solution
Collaborates to identify and prioritize product and integration enhancements based on client requests and technical obstacles
Develops program and system specifications to meet customers’ technical requirements
Conducts process assessments with customers, builds proof of concept to validate requirements, builds and presents customer specific business cases.
Provides technical information, requirements and cost estimates for proposals, quotes and statements of work
Documents processes and solutions for reuse and scalability
Collaborates with clients post-sales to ensure their success
Minimum Qualifications
5+ years of relevant experience (working in solutions engineering, technical sales, software development)
Excellent verbal, written, presentation and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to process and understand technical documentation
Deep technical expertise in Cloud and Enterprise Software
Pre-sales or post-sales experience working in a SaaS software company
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor’s in computer science or solid knowledge of CS fundamentals
Experience in the cybersecurity field
Experience with encryption technologies
Experience programming with Python, Rust, C, C++
Attitude
You are comfortable working in an environment built around security and privacy
You want to be part of a team creating products that impact the world for better
You are self-motivated, a strong individual contributor with intellectual curiosity and propensity for action, results and continuous process improvement
You are a strong communicator, able to communicate with stakeholders, helping to define the product roadmap by providing technical expertise
You are interested in working with leading technologies in data and information security, including quantum encryption, post-quantum cryptography, and privacy preservation techniques
Benefits & Perks
Competitive Pay & Equity
Medical, dental & vision plan participation
Strong 401K matching program
In-office free lunch & snacks
Gym Reimbursement
But above all, be part of an amazing team! Together, we’ll make this world a safer place!
About Qrypt
Qrypt is an early-stage technology startup building the next generation of cryptography to protect from the threat of quantum computers and those machines and mathematics yet to be invented. Our passion is to help organizations and people keep their data private – forever. We securely build, design, and deploy safe systems that ensure people’s privacy. Together, we will transform the way the world safeguards data and communications!
The worldwide cyber community is undergoing a once-in-a-generation transition to quantum-safe technologies, with Qrypt leading the way. Qrypt participates in global standards bodies for communications security, financial transactions, and critical infrastructure. We are founding members of the national Quantum Economic Development Consortium and the Mid-Atlantic Quantum Alliance.
The annual base pay range for this role is between $125,000 and $175,000. The actual base salary pay offered may vary based on multiple factors such as qualifications, experience, transferable skills, level of education, and other factors permitted by law. Please note that this salary information is solely for candidates hired to perform work in this location and refers to the amount Qrypt is willing to pay at the time of this posting. The range listed is just one component of Qrypt's total compensation package.
90SiVDTApV
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $125,000.00 - $175,000.00 per year

title: Technical Product Manager
description:
Ready to join the AQ era?
SandboxAQ is solving challenging problems with AI + Quantum for positive impact. We partner with global leaders in government, academia, and the private sector to identify applications that would benefit from quantum-based applications to current and future commercial challenges. We engage with customers early and throughout the development process to improve market fit.
Our team's unique approach enables cross-pollination across a diverse range of fields, from physics, computer science, neuroscience, mathematics, cryptography, natural sciences and more! Our success comes from coalescing diverse talent to create an environment where experimental thinking and collaboration yield breakthrough AI + Quantum solutions. Join a culture where thought leadership, diverse talent, employee engagement, and technological impact will create the next tech uproar.
We are deeply committed to education as a means to advance quantum solutions and computing initiatives. We invest in future talent through internship programs, research papers, developer tools, textbooks, educational talks/events and partnerships with universities/talent hubs to attract multi-disciplinary talent. Our hope is to inspire people from all walks of life to be prepared for the quantum era and encourage a path in STEM.
About The Role:

SandboxAQ is a global team exploring the intersection of physics and artificial intelligence. We pursue near-term impact through rapid prototyping of quantum and quantum-inspired platforms that can be deployed by enterprises to surmount real-world challenges. At SandboxAQ we cross-pollinate ideas among a range of fields - natural sciences, computer science, medicine, and mathematics, to name just a few - to approach problems from a novel perspective. Our goal is to create a world-leading platform to revolutionize material design, chemical analysis, and drug development.
We are looking for a Product Manager who will ensure the success of our novel AI and Quantum platform for drug discovery. As a Product Manager, you will help shape the product vision, get deep with the technical team, and will drive the product strategy and roadmap for this new product. You will identify business opportunities, understand customer needs, and analyze market requirements to help us create a leading computational software platform. You will set milestones and prioritize development to reach our goals in a timely manner. You will align stakeholders, build consensus, and drive decision-making. You will build and nurture partnerships with industry leaders, the scientific community, and high-profile stakeholders.
Core Responsibilities:
Own product strategy and roadmap for our computational software platform.
Coordinate strategy and help translate product vision into tactical roadmap and organization planning. Advocate for your plans effectively across the organization.
Qualitatively and quantitatively identify business opportunities in the space of high-performance computational modeling in general, and material and drug design in particular
Work with a multidisciplinary team of research scientists and engineers to bring our platform vision to life
Assess the current landscape of quantum-aided and quantum-inspired technologies
Working closely with customers, align technical development with customer requirements, customer feedback and market requirements
Identify and build relationships with industry leaders and research institutions to formulate and secure strategic partnerships
Who you are:
3+ years industry experience in a product manager role, with experience executing from product vision to launch
You have a track record of setting milestones, assessing/adjusting priorities, and delivering what you promised
You are comfortable navigating conflicting priorities and ambiguous problems and thrive in a fast moving startup environment
Ph.D. or commensurate experience in Physics, Chemistry, Bioinformatics or related field
5+ years industry experience in computational chemistry or related software engineering role
Solid understanding of scientific concepts, and ability to lead high-level scientific discussions about molecular biology, computational chemistry, material science or computational physics
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including the ability to explain complex ideas to a broad audience
Capable of establishing strong working relationships across a distributed organization.
Preferred Qualifications
5+ years industry experience in a product manager role
Experience with drug discovery and bringing projects from ideation to market.
Experience developing and launching products in both the private and public sector in areas related to materials, drug design, or similar
Proficiency with AI and/or scientific computing
Masters or Ph.D. in one of the STEM fields or related areas
SandboxAQ welcomes all.
We are committed to creating an inclusive culture where we have zero tolerance for discrimination. We invest in our employees' personal and professional growth. Once you work with us, you can't go back to normalcy because great breakthroughs come from great teams and we are the best in quantum technology.
We offer competitive salaries, stock options depending on employment type, education stipends, medical/dental/vision, family planning/fertility, PTO (summer and winter breaks), financial wellness resources, 401(k) plans, and more.
Equal Employment Opportunity: All qualified applicants will receive consideration regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
Accommodations: we provide reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in job application procedures for open roles. If you need such an accommodation.

title: Experimental Physicist
description:
Overview:
SRI International's Advanced Technology and Systems Division (ATSD) performs research and development across a wide range of technical domains for applications including advanced sensing, imaging, navigation and timing systems. SRI specializes in transitioning technology from basic R&D to fieldable prototypes for both US government and commercial customers.

SRI ATSD has an opening for Experimental Physicist within the Quantum & Semiconductor (Q&S) Laboratory in Princeton, NJ. The Q&S Lab conducts R&D in the domains of quantum sensing (cold-atom through vapor-cell physics), III-V semiconductors and device physics toward single-photon imaging systems, and mixed-signal electronics for national security applications. In each of these areas, we develop new technologies with applications in electromagnetic field sensing, Positioning, Navigation, and Timing (PNT), Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR), low-light short-wave infrared imaging, and chip-scale mixed-signal hardware security.
Responsibilities:
A successful applicant will have a general experimental physics background and will work in the laboratory with other scientists and engineers on a variety of topics. They will contribute on current programs and grow into a task leader and Principal Investigator (PI).

A successful applicant will have a PhD in physics, applied physics, or engineering. The exact domain of expertise is less important than a demonstrated ability to develop both hardware and software in an R&D context. They will be very comfortable in the lab, operating with initiative to design, build and integrate new experimental setups that involve advanced AMO and/or device physics instrumentation (optical, mechanical, vacuum, electronic, and instrumentation subsystems).
Qualifications:
PhD in experimental physics, electrical engineering, applied physics, engineering physics, or related discipline
Due to government requirements, U.S. Citizenship is required with the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance

Must have experience in:
Developing R&D plans to solve complex problems
Laboratory experimental hardware development experience
General data analysis skills, typical of those learned in graduate school physics and engineering programs
Presentation of complex technical topics to a diverse audience
Working in teams
Managing multiple priorities
Reviewing technical work of others and providing actionable feedback

Desirable skills include:
Experience in precision measurements
Photon shot noise limited measurements
Experience with all, or subsets of, laser systems, optics, vacuum systems, RF, electronics and data-acquisition systems
Knowledge of electromagnetics
Experience with laboratory design and testing of optical systems, including photonic integrated circuits.
Should also possess strong numerical and analytical modeling skills (e.g. Python, Matlab, C++, COMSOL, etc.)
Working knowledge of data acquisition and control systems (e.g. LabView) and signal processing
Familiarity with physical measurements and laboratory instrumentation
Physical and mechanical intuition
Intangibles
Detail-oriented
Strong written and verbal communications skills
Able to work in a team environment
Self-motivated
Must possess a results-oriented approach
Interest in a broad range of technical areas

SRI International, an over 75-year strong pioneering research institute, has a rich history supporting government and industry. Our innovations have created new industries, billions of dollars in market value and lasting benefits to society. SRI is organized around broad disciplines and capabilities, with research and development divisions and labs to groups who excel at identifying new opportunities, developing products and creating custom solutions. Our organization is driven by impact - delivering unique solutions for the world's important challenges and transforming ideas into reality for clients and partners.

position: Principal Quantum Physicist/Sr. Principal Quantum Physicist
location: Location: Linthicum, Maryland, United States of America

description:
At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

Northrop Grumman Mission Systems is seeking Physicists. The qualified candidate will become part of Northrop Grumman’s Transformational Technology Business Area, which is focused on developing innovative next generation superconducting electronics (SCE) and advanced computing technologies.

title: Software Development Manager - Quantum Software
description:
About Xanadu:
Xanadu’s mission is to build quantum computers that are useful and available to people everywhere.

At Xanadu, we are learners, innovators, researchers, collaborators and problem solvers. We are creating something that has never been built before. What we are doing is extremely hard, the classic moon shot. Few people in their life will be able to be a part of something like this, where if we are successful, the technologies we develop will solve some of the world’s most challenging problems, and literally change the world. And that is something to be excited about!

title: Staff Systems Engineer
description:
IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ's computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.

We are looking for Systems Engineers (multiple levels) with experience in leading and supporting multi-disciplined engineering teams through the product development lifecycle. As a member of the Engineering organization, you'll be part of a cross-functional team whose mission is to lead IonQ on its journey to build the world's best quantum computers to solve the world's most complex problems.
In this role you will develop requirements, model architectures, complete trade studies, define verification criteria, and complete system analyses for our current and next generation of quantum computers.
Responsibilities:
Lead/Support development teams in the System Engineering lifecycle for quantum computing programs/projects including requirements development, architecture decomposition, system analyses (reliability, maintainability, etc.), integration and test planning, and system verification
Translate stakeholder and product requirements into design specifications
Perform operational and functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation, and interface definition for first of a kind prototypes as well as production quantum computing systems
Support program & executive leadership through the identification of risk and risk mitigation plans
Support technical publications of system requirements documents, interface control documents, verification procedures and reports
Hands-on modeling, design, integration, test, and verification support of our quantum computers across lab facilities requiring skills in algorithms, software, hardware, and networking
You'd be a good fit with:
B.S. in Electrical, Mechanical, or Systems Engineering, Physics, or related subject area
A breadth of deep understanding, backed by experience, of the principles, concepts, and methods of systems engineering such as concept development, requirement definition, functional decomposition and allocation, design solution definition, implementation, integration, verification and validation, qualification, commissioning, and operations
Experience with system performance definition through requirements analysis using modeling tools
Understanding of industry best practices in requirements creation, decomposition, and management
Demonstrated technical depth with one or more of the following subject areas and/or subsystems:
Trapped ion systems
AMO physics
Ultra-high vacuum systems
Chip scale device design, packaging, and fabrication – semiconductor level modules and systems
Optics and lasers (NIR and visible, pulsed and CW), precision micro- and bulk- optics, free space and fiber, optical sensors

title:

description:

DESCRIPTION
Job summary
The AWS Center for Quantum Computing is hiring a software engineer with expertise in electronic computer-aided design automation, computational geometry, and/or research software engineering. Working in a team of scientists and engineers, you will develop software for the automated design, layout, and simulation of superconducting or hybrid quantum devices and their packaging. Your work will enable the robust and scalable development of quantum information processors.

Work/Life Balance
We understand that developing quantum computing technology is a marathon, not a sprint. Mental and physical wellness is encouraged within our team and throughout AWS. The work/life integration within Amazon encourages a culture where employees work hard and have ownership over their downtime. We are exploring more structured wellness elements including for example meditation, running group meet-ups, and other wellness tips.

Mentorship and Career Growth
We are committed to the growth and development of every member of the Center for Quantum Computing. You will receive career-growth-minded management and mentorship from a software and science team and also have the opportunity to participate in Amazon's science mentorship programs.

Inclusive and Diverse Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

We are open to having someone sit in Seattle or Boston.

Key job responsibilities
Building software tools to automate the design, layout, and simulation of quantum devices and their packaging.
Mentoring research scientists who actively contribute to the codebase through pair programming, design review, and code review.

About the team
Our team is comprised of scientists and engineers from a variety of backgrounds. Our diverse perspectives help us innovate in quantum hardware design and design tools.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
1+ years of experience contributing to the system design or architecture (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.
2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience
Programming experience with at least one software programming language.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
The following are criteria of an ideal candidate but not required:
M.S. or Ph.D. in computer science, physics, or related field.
Expertise in electronic computer-aided design automation, computational geometry, and/or research software engineering.
Track record of open source contributions.
Experience with the Julia programming language.
Experience working in a research environment with other engineers and scientists, especially on device design and/or device fabrication.
Curiosity and capability to research and learn new techniques or technical topics rapidly.
